He, however, did not help his brother, but took his royal castles and imprisoned Wenceslas, for not just rule did Sigismund take, but the crown of Bohemia as well, which a certain fraction of the Lords did welcome, for they were glad to see order and law restored in the kingdom. In these days, King Wenceslas remains Sigismund’s captive, whilst Sigismund, the Ginger Fox, plunders Bohemia. </p>

<p align='center'><font size='25'> 《瓦茨拉夫四世》 </font></p> <br/><p align='left'> 他是波西米亚的管理者，前神圣罗马帝国的皇帝，尽管有支持他同父异母的兄弟，西格斯蒙德的奸人散布谗言，指责他并非真正的皇帝。公元1361年，皇帝查理四世之后，希维德尼察的安娜，生下了瓦茨拉夫，以长子的身份继承了父亲的皇位。在两岁时，他被加冕为波西米亚国王；在十五岁时，年纪轻轻的他登上了皇位。这两个举动都引起了多方的不满，因为在前任国王在位期间令立新王的举措很不符合传统，而且年轻的国王必须要等到成年以后，才能执掌这个国家的大权。 <br/> <br/> 后来，国王兼皇帝查理驾崩后，瓦茨拉夫名正言顺地接受了两个头衔。最开始，他的统治很得民心，但顽固不化的朝臣以及愚昧的欧洲封建领主给了他不小的打击。于是，国王抛弃了他热诚的初心，整日酗酒打猎。由此，王国境内对新任统治者不满的呼声越来越高，而瓦茨拉夫，毫不思索如何挽救局势，选择了逃避现实，因为他认为没必要去解决那些问题。结果，由于不想激怒法国人拥立的阿维尼翁教皇，他放弃了王位。而瓦茨拉夫这种懦弱的做法激怒了摩拉维亚的边境伯爵，摩拉维亚的约布斯特将他监禁了起来，逼迫他主动解决国家的问题。但是瓦茨拉夫不但不愿去解决国家的乱局，反而还固执地坚持不理朝政的态度。随后，瓦茨拉夫为其兄弟约翰救出，可王国内的不满情绪继续升级，贵族们甚至组成了“领主联盟”，志在废黜瓦茨拉夫，妄图拥立其二弟，统治匈牙利的西格斯蒙德为王。瓦茨拉夫没有意识到来自领主的威胁与警告，继续随心所欲地处理朝政，或者享受花天酒地的奢靡。当领主们对他的行为再也忍无可忍的时候，他们爆发了起义。瓦茨拉夫遂请求二弟西格斯蒙德的帮助，他相信二弟能助他平定叛乱。但西格斯蒙德并没有帮助他的兄长，反而夺取了他的皇家城堡，将瓦茨拉夫囚禁了起来，从而西格斯蒙德不仅控制了整个王国的命运，还夺去了波西米亚的王座。而这便是很多领主们想要看到的结果，因为他们更乐意看到王国恢复它的秩序与和平。如今，瓦茨拉夫国王是西格斯蒙德的囚犯，而“红狐狸”西格斯蒙德，却将波西米亚的财富洗劫一空。 </p>

<p align='center'><font size='25'>King Sigismund of Hungary</font></p> <br/><p align='left'> The son of Emperor Charles IV and his fourth wife Elizabeth of Pomerania may not have inherited the royal or imperial throne, as his brother Wenceslas did, but from his father his slyness, intelligence, and political talent he did inherit—qualities his brother, the future king, was desperately lacking. For the ginger hair he was born with and his slyness, which he did display many a time in his youth, he was given the sobriquet of The Ginger Fox, by which he was later called by his enemies especially. Sigismund is learned and popular, and his great indulgence is competing in tourneys, and seven languages of the world does he speak. Since 1387 he has been the King of Hungary, when he wed Mary of Hungary, who was at the time engaged to be married to the Duke of Orleans, and thus many of evil tongue do say he took her by force and unjustly. However it may have been though, he successfully defended his right to rule Hungary.<br/> <br/> Later, seeing his brother Wenceslas’s inability to rule, he did collude with Jobst of Moravia and did commence to plot against Wenceslas, who ended up in his captivity with the great support of the Czech noblemen, who would rather see Sigismund sit upon the throne than an inept ruler who devotes his time and efforts more to drinking and hunting than to performing his royal duties. But Wenceslas was freed by his other brother, and thus Sigismund’s plan to seize power in Bohemia failed. In the year 1396 Sigismund planned a Crusade and took up arms against the Ottoman Turks, but to the misfortune of all Christians he was defeated at the Battle of Nicopolis, and thus he removed himself to Hungary. Later, when his brother Wenceslas’s rule in Bohemia deteriorated to the point where his own nobility rose up against him, he called upon his brother for assistance. And he did truly set off to Bohemia with a powerful Hungarian army, but being knowledgeable of the local situation, instead of helping his brother he occupied his castles and towns and had his brother imprisoned, taking the crown for himself and finally bringing order to the land. Many do say he is a traitor, whilst others do praise his deeds. In all respects, however, he is indeed a much better ruler. </p>

<p align='center'><font size='25'> 《匈牙利王西格斯蒙德》 </font></p> <br/><p align='left'> 查理四世与第四任王后伊丽莎白之子，没能像他的兄长瓦茨拉夫那样继承贵族或皇家的王位，但却继承了他父亲的谋略，智慧，以及政治天赋-他的兄长，未来的国王，所毫不具备的。他天生一头红发，又因为他年轻时常常展现他的足智多谋，人送外号“红狐狸”，日后，这个称呼尤其在他的对手之间流传甚广。西格斯蒙德学识渊博，受人爱戴，他痴迷于骑士竞技，会说七种不同的语言。1378年，他成为了匈牙利王，迎娶匈牙利的玛丽为妻。时年，匈牙利的玛丽正准备嫁入奥尔良公爵之门，故有谗言说西格斯蒙德强行逼婚，占有了玛丽。不管真相如何，他都通过这场联姻巩固了在匈牙利的统治。 <br/> <br/> 后来，看到兄长瓦茨拉夫不理朝政，他与摩拉维亚的约布斯特勾结，企图废黜瓦茨拉夫，伙同捷克的贵族一起，使瓦茨拉夫沦为了阶下囚。捷克的贵族们拥立西格斯蒙德为王，因为他们想要推翻那个整日不务正业酗酒打猎取乐的统治者。但瓦茨拉夫很快被他的另一个弟弟所救，西格斯蒙德夺取波西米亚大权的计划落空。公元1396年，西格斯蒙德发起了一场东征，讨伐奥斯曼突厥人，不幸败走胜利城，震动了整个基督教世界。战败归来，西格斯蒙德便被匈牙利驱逐。后来，他的兄长瓦茨拉夫于波西米亚的统治堕落不堪，以至于贵族们开始纷纷起兵反叛之时，他请求西格斯蒙德的支援。西格斯蒙德随即带领一支强大的匈牙利军队进发波西米亚，但是对地形了如指掌的他，非但没有帮助他的兄长，反而乘虚而入，占据了兄长的城堡和乡镇，并将他再次监禁起来，顺便夺取了王位，获得了波西米亚王国的统治权，使乱局重新归于稳定。很多人都说他是个叛徒，而也有人对他赞许有加。但是不论世人如何评说，他都是个比瓦茨拉夫更好的统治者。 </p>

<p align='center'><font size='25'>Excerpt from the Legend of Christianus</font></p> <br/><p align='left'>In the Frankish lands there lived a man whose legs were crippled. In his dreams there appeared to him a man attired in a white robe, who urged him thus: Get up and go to the City of Prague and the Cathedral of St. Vitus; there lies the body of the blessed martyr Wenceslas, and there your health shall be restored. When the man ignored this, the man in a white robe appeared to him again and said: Why have you not heeded me and gone, that you might walk again? And he, beside his wits did answer willingly: I will go, Sir. And leaning on his cane he went to some merchants, who were getting ready to go there and paid them and with their help came to the named place. And there in the church of the two saints he threw himself on the flags before all and with long prayers and weeping begged Our Lord to have mercy on him for the sake of Saint Wenceslas. And no sooner did he stand up from prayer, than by divine grace his knees were firmed. And he gave thanks to God and to blessed Wenceslas, by whose intercession the Lord deigned to heal him. <br/> <br/> When the glory and renown of this and other such miracles of the sacred martyr spread far and wide, there were those who were tempted to take the remains of the sacred body to keep for themselves or give to their loved ones. There were those who acted by good will, that the name of the martyr be spoken of in all the provinces, but when those of ill-will or out of covetousness tried to do so, they soon succumbed to vengeance.At that time, the saint’s own sister Přibyslava, as far as the human eye can judge, living beneath a sacred veil, did get embroiled in such things, her accomplice in the matter being the priest of St. Stephen’s Church. But by the church there was a pilgrim, who they took to be saintly and whose bad advice they heeded to do the deed. <br/> <br/>To make a short tale of it, taking him with them on the appointed night they made him a party to their unfortunate deed: disinterring the sacred body, they began their desecration. For the priest’s son did disrespectfully handle the jaw of the saintly remains and pulled it out. This they wrapped in a cloth and covered the rest of the body again with earth. From the relic they took, they kept what share they wanted and distributed the rest among their friends. But soon the wrath of God descended on them all. However, since, as is known, this happened recently and is abundantly familiar, I regard it as superfluous to put it in this account. I only write down that sudden and unexpected deaths surprised them and they departed from this world.</p>

<p align='center'><font size='25'> 克里斯丁乌尼斯传奇·节选 </font></p> <br/><p align='left'>法兰克境内有一位双腿残废的男子。他梦见了一个身着白色长袍的男人，那个男人对他讲：起身，前去布拉格城，拜访圣维特斯大教堂；那里保存着殉道者瓦茨拉夫被赐福的遗骸，而在那里，你也能重新走路了。男子没有听从吩咐，而那个身着白色长袍的男人再次出现在了他的梦里，并对他说：为什么不听我的劝告，启程去让你的双腿恢复健康？而他，不顾一切地坚定回答道：我会前去，大人。然后他便拄着拐杖前去找了一些正要前往布拉格的商人，付了钱，让他们帮助他到达了目的地。在那供奉着两位圣人的教堂，众目睽睽之下，他跪倒在旗帜上，祈祷了很久，哭求我主以圣瓦茨拉夫的名义宽恕他。没过多久，他便站了起来，上帝赐福，他的双腿如常人一般健康了。他由衷地感谢上帝，以及向请求上帝屈尊治好他的双腿的神圣的瓦茨拉夫。 <br/> <br/> 当这件事以及其他神迹的传奇远播四方，有人便开始收集圣人的遗骸，自己保存收藏，或者送给他们的眷属。动机好的人，将殉道者的美名颂扬到各处，但那些动机坏的人，或者是本性贪心之人，他们很快便受到了报复。那时，圣人的妹妹，总在表面上遮盖着一层神圣的面纱的普利比斯拉娃，就卷入了这样一起事件，她的帮凶是圣斯蒂芬教堂的牧师。他们将一位朝圣者错认成了圣人，并且听从了他糟糕的建议。 <br/> <br/>事情大致是这样的，在他们事先约定好的那个晚上，那位朝圣者陪伴着普利比斯拉娃等人做了这件不幸的恶事：他们掘出了圣人的遗骸，并且亵渎了圣体。牧师的儿子大逆不道地将圣人的下巴从遗骸的头部拔了下来。他们将圣人的下巴用布包裹起来，将剩下的遗骸重新埋回了土里。他们将从这个遗骸上获得的暴利分赃，把余下的赃款分给他们的同伙。很快，上帝的制裁便降临在他们所有人头上。但是，众所周知，这是近期发生的事情，大多细节已然是众所周知，我认为在此耗费笔墨，显得有些多余。我只想指出，突如其来的死亡令这些恶人措手不及，他们早已不在人世了。 </p>

My dear T,<br/> When I discussed with you our "currency reform", I certainly did not anticipate how the situation would develop. On no account did I consent to the coin in question being put to the purpose of recruiting bandits and mercenaries, thereby giving rise to widespread slaughter and unrest in the province. It hardly bears thinking about what might occur, should someone connect us to the massacre at Neuhof. I hereby give notice to you, Honourable Sir, that I do not intend to participate further in any enterprises with you or with your resources. I urge you too to proceed with greater restraint, for it has come to my attention that a certain German knight from Passau has been making enquiries in the region about the counterfeit Groschen. This knight, I am told, is presently staying at an inn in Sasau. There are too many pairs of eyes turning in our direction. I hope and trust that you shall understand and respect my decision to terminate our collaboration. My deepest respects, S.

尊敬的T阁下， <br/> 在你我定夺“货币改革”计划之初，我万万没有想到结果会是这样。我从没准许过用资金招募土匪或者雇佣军，在国土上横行霸道烧杀掳掠。要是有人把我们和诺伊霍夫大屠杀联系起来，后果将不堪设想。通过这封信我想表明拒绝和你以及你的同党继续合作的态度。我强烈建议你们也尽早收手，因为已经有一名来自帕绍的德国骑士在探听邻国的假币情况了。他就住在帕绍的酒馆。隔墙有耳，四面楚歌。我只希望你们明白，我将停止一切与你们的合作。呈上我由衷的敬意，S。

We, the Aldermen of the great and glorious City of Passau, do hereby wish God's Grace and Mercy, and do offer Goodwill to all and sundry Princes, religious and secular, Dukes and Counts, Margraves, Barons, Lords and other Nobles, Chamberlains, Ministers and Counsellors, Knights and Squires, Hetmen and Captains, Customs Officials, Treasurers and Officials and Bailiffs of Cities, Towns and Villages and other Settlements, and their Elders and Governors and to all Others who are subject and faithful to the Holy Roman Empire and to all who, by the Grace of Our Lord Jesus Christ, shall take into their hands this missal.<br/>Esteemed, gracious, noble and faithful Friends!We hereby recommend to You each and all the holder of this parchment, the venerable knight Sir Ulrich, good gentleman and our loyal friend, who shall soon come to your Kingdom of Bohemia as our Envoy and Emissary, and we ask You to receive him upon his arrival with the same good will and respect you graciously afford us, to treat him kindly and to suffer him to travel and to assist him in his journey, and to allow him Safe Conduct over all roads, ports, bridges, lands, fiefdoms, counties, provinces, cities, towns, castles, villages and any other places in your Kingdom of Bohemia, and by your good grace to see to Sir Ulrich's safe and unmolested passage in his mission to uphold the Honour and good name of our great city.<br/>Set down in the City of Passau, in the Year of Our Lord 1403.$new_page;

我们，光荣伟大的帕绍城的议员，颂扬上帝高贵仁慈，向诸位亲王，无论教廷或世俗，公爵和伯爵，侯爵，男爵，领主及其他贵族成员，堡主，大臣和参事，骑士和乡绅，武将和军官，海关官员，财务官和城市、乡镇、村庄以及其他行政区划的管理员及执政官，还有长老及其他官员，所有隶属效忠于神圣罗马帝国，所有追随无上的主，耶稣·基督，日夜祈祷劳作的臣民，在此敬礼。 <br/> 我尊贵，荣耀，富贵，忠实的朋友们！我们特此向诸位介绍这份证件的持有者，尊敬的骑士，伍尔里希阁下，一位遵纪守法的公民，我们忠实的朋友，即将作为我们的使臣出使波西米亚王国。特此我们请求诸位以平日对待我们同样的热情与尊敬迎接他，友善接待他，准许他在境内自由出行，给予他的出行以帮助和照顾，保证他安全通行波西米亚王国境内所有的道路，港口，桥梁，土地，封地，县，省，城市，乡镇，城堡，村庄，及其他所有行政区划。以诸位的恩典，请保护伍尔里希在其出使任务中的通行安全且不受干扰，由此维护我们伟大城市的名誉及荣耀。 <br/> 帕绍城，公元1403书。 $new_page;
<p align='center'><font size='36'>Safe Conduct</font><br/><font color='#990000'>accorded to the good gentleman Ulrich of Passau;</font></p>$new_page;
<p align='center'><font size='36'> 《通行证》 </font><br/><font color='#990000'> 帕绍公民伍尔里希所有 ;</font></p>$new_page;

On April 2, a test was conducted in Passau of a coin, which was a forgery of the Prague Groschen recently discovered in the Passau House of Exchange. The test was conducted by Master Johannes Bergmann, Honourable Councillor of the City of Passau, who was entrusted with the task by the City Council and who, as a jeweller and goldsmith, has much experience in such matters. The test was supervised by the Deputies of the City Council Mssrs. Joachim Falkenberg, Konrad called Honey-Tongued and Kuno Eiser. Master Bergmann surmised that the forgeries were very well fashioned and for a layman difficult to distinguish from genuine currency. It was also found that the counterfeit had been made by a new method, as yet unfamiliar to Master Bergmann. The core of the coin is stamped from copper sheet and the same is plated with silver amalgam in imitation of the genuine article. The Master Jeweller also noted that the design of the coin is sharply etched and of fine quality, indicating that the counterfeiters had at their disposal a very well-crafted punch.

四月二日，近日于帕绍交易中心发现的布拉格格罗申假币，在帕绍接受了抽样检测。检测由约翰内斯·贝格曼大师，一位尊贵的帕绍城议员，指挥引导下进行。他受到城市议会的信任，又是一位珠宝商及金匠，在辨识伪造货币方面有深厚经验。检测由市议会长老代表全程监督。约阿希姆·法尔肯伯格，“老油嘴”康拉德，以及库诺·艾泽。贝格曼大师得出结论，这批假币做了精密的高仿处理，以假乱真，蒙骗外行人。也有发现指出，这批假币是由一种全新的手段打制而成，贝格曼大师对这种高仿手段不甚了解。假币的内核由铜片冲压而成，进而用银汞合金包装，以模仿真币。珠宝大师同时也指出，假币的设计雕刻细致，质量极高，暗示这群假币制造者绝非等闲之辈，手艺精湛至极。
<p align='center'><font size='36'>Record</font><br/><font color='#990000'>of Examination of the Coin</font></p>$new_page;
<p align='center'><font size='36'>Record</font><br/><font color='#990000'> 《关于货币的检测结果》 </font></p>$new_page;

I, the bold Knight Sir Sebastian vom Berg, do hereby charge the man-at-arms Prokesh and his company to patrol Sasau Woods and to keep watch and maintain law and order and protect honest folk against Cumans and other brigands and to seek out and challenge any such foes and deal with them as befits. In these aforementioned matters, they may present themselves and act in my name. <br/> <br/>Assigned in Sasau and witnessed by Abbot Peter of Sasau Monastery and Bailiff Hashek.
我，英勇的骑士，塞巴斯蒂安·冯·伯格男爵，特此任命Prokesh和他的士兵们巡逻并看守莎邵的树林；维护法律和秩序；守护大伙们免遭库曼人和强盗的侵犯并找出任何这样的敌人，在适当的时候解决他们。在这些事上，他们可以以我的名义行事。 <br/> <br/> 由莎邵修道院院长彼得和执政官哈舍克于莎邵签署并见证。

Radzig Kobyla, you unscrupulous beast, devoid of Christian morals, I accuse you! You abandoned all honour and virtue when you perpetrated acts of cruelty and malevolence against me and my forebears. I call you a cur for committing those vile deeds, which you certainly remember well. <br/><br/>I challenge you to face me in a duel, as befits knightly virtue, to desist from cowardly concealment behind castle walls and to defend your honour and that of your House, as behoves noble status. If you decline to do so, I will travel this land and truthfully make known to all that you are an ignominious wretch, unfit for the company of decent men, and I shall have your shield nailed to the pillory as a mark of shame. <br/><br/>I swear before God that I act justly, bound by my family honour, and perpetrate against you only that which you deserve. My grievance is only against you, but the longer you hide from me in a cowardly manner, the longer shall I maraud and plunder in this province. Be it upon your own head!<br/><br/><br/>Signed on June 2nd in the year 1403 by Sir Hagen Zoul.

拉德季·科比拉，你这厮不择手段，你是基督徒的耻辱，我在此谴责你！当你对我和我的弟兄们进行残酷恶毒的迫害之时，你就背弃了你所有的荣誉和美德！你肯定还记得你做过的那些卑鄙的行为，你真的是个狗逼！ <br/><br/> 作为一名高尚的骑士，我在此向你发出决斗！不要怯懦地躲在城堡里面，出来捍卫你作为贵族的最后一点尊严！如果你拒绝的话，我会周游这片地方，告诉所有人你是个可耻的混蛋！告诉大家正直的人不适合与尔为伍，并且把印有你的纹章的盾钉在木枷上象征着耻辱！ <br/><br/> 我向上帝起誓，并以我家族的名誉担保我在做正义的事情，只进行对你罪有应得的惩罚。我针对的只是你，但只要你在城堡里躲着的时间越长，我就会越久地劫掠你的土地。记清楚了！ <br/><br/><br/> 哈根·祖尔爵士 签于一四零三年六月二日

I, by the will of God Papal Inquisitor and Bishop of Sarepta, Jaroslav of Beneshov, hereby confirm that the bearer of this document is a member of my retinue and as such must be accorded the honour befitting that station and must not be hindered from carrying out my commands, but must be offered every compliance thereto.
我，贝内绍夫的雅罗斯洛夫，神授教宗审判者和Sarepta的主教，特此确认文档持有者为本人的随从，因此，必须给予相对应的尊敬并不得对其有任何阻扰，另外出具证明必须合理有据。

<p align='center'><font size='30'> Leave of Absence</font><br/><font color='#990000'>for Master Konrad Kyeser</font></p>$new_page;<p>I, Peter of Zbyshov, Abbot of the Monastery of St. Procopius in Sasau, do hereby consent that Master Engineer Konrad Kyeser may interrupt his work on construction engines for the monastery and may depart from the monastery to lend his skills to Sir Divish of Talmberg and aid his endeavours to besiege Talmberg Castle, which has fallen to the enemy. Master Konrad shall return within one month.</p><p align='right'><img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/signature.dds' width='200' height='128'></p>

<p align='center'><font size='30'> 《出差假条》 </font><br/><font color='#990000'> 康拉德·吉赛尔大师 </font></p>$new_page;<p> 吾，比肖夫的彼得，莎邵圣普罗科匹厄斯修道院的院长，特此准许大工程师康拉德·吉赛尔，暂停修道院的建设工作，即刻前去支援塔尔木堡的戴卫斯阁下，为重夺落入敌手的塔尔木堡贡献自己的微薄之力。康拉德大师须在一月之内返回，切不可耽搁。 </p><p align='right'><img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/signature.dds' width='200' height='128'></p>

<p align='center'><font size='30'> Commission to Conduct Building Works </font><br/><font color='#990000'>Concluded with Karel Parler</font></p>$new_page;<p align='justify'> I, Peter of Zbyshov, being the Abbot of the Monastery of St. Procopius in Sasau, do hereby issue to Master Builder Karel Parler this Commission to Conduct Building Works at the Monastery and the Church thereat, to wit: to ensure construction which shall be executed in such a manner as to give glory to God almighty and shall serve to reflect the splendour of his Heavenly Kingdom here on Earth.</p><p align='right'><img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/signature.dds' width='200' height='128'></p>

<p align='center'><font size='30'> 《指挥建筑工程的委任状》 </font><br/><font color='#990000'> 与卡雷尔·帕勒商议后决定 </font></p>$new_page;<p align='justify'> 吾，比肖夫的彼得，特此向建筑师卡雷尔·帕勒颁发指挥修道院与教堂建筑工程的委任状，以监督：保证建筑工程要为全能的上帝带来荣耀，同时反映天国在地上的辉煌。 </p><p align='right'><img src='img://Libs/UI/Textures/Dynamic/signature.dds' width='200' height='128'></p>

One day a countryman going to the nest of his Goose found there an egg all yellow and glittering. When he took it up it was as heavy as lead and he was going to throw it away, because he thought a trick had been played upon him. But he took it home on second thoughts, and soon found to his delight that it was an egg of pure gold. Every morning the same thing occurred, and he soon became rich by selling his eggs. As he grew rich he grew greedy;and thinking to get at once all the gold the Goose could give, he killed it and opened it only to find nothing.
一天，一个农夫在他的鹅窝找到了一枚金黄闪闪的鹅蛋。但他把它拿起来的时候，感觉这枚鹅蛋如同铅铁一般沉重。他想起曾经有人那这跟他开过玩笑，便要扔掉这枚鹅蛋。但他转念一想，还是将它带回了家，马上发现这枚鹅蛋乃是纯金所制。此后，每天早上同样的好事都会发生，他通过卖金蛋，变得愈发富有，也愈发贪婪。他妄图一次性把鹅能生产的金蛋全部取走，便把鹅宰了，抛开它的肚子，发现里面什么都没有。

God and Our Lord Jesus Christ forsake those men who prove themselves unworthy, and give their treasures and riches to women according to the Word: that God chose that which is weak to cast shame upon that which is strong. <br/> <br/>For men, when they excel at something, are excessively vainglorious, giving credit only to their own actions and forgetting Our Lord Jesus Christ. <br/> <br/>Therefore, wives, virgins and widows are elevated in our times, succumbing to discipline, living the most noble lives and venerating the Heavenly Kingdom before men, who are occupied only with the vanities of this world. Therefore, women fill the churches, spend their time in prayer and listening to sermons, reject entertainments, vanities and ostentation and surpass men in devotion and love of Christ. <br/> <br/>Women think constantly of the concerns of Our Lord, lingering in veneration until they are brought to tears, and nourish ever more their love of Christ. <br/> <br/>In divine mercy and manifest visions and prophesies, women, I say, are one hundred times more gifted than any man and perhaps even priests. <br/> <br/>It seems, therefore, that the gift of prophecy and intimacy with the Holy Spirit is often bequeathed now to women. To them are revealed the great mysteries of God and great wisdom, as we know from the example of the acclaimed virgin Hildegard, the saintly Bridget and many other women who already comprise a procession. These have I seen in Paris, Rome, Nuremberg and in Prague.

上帝和我们的主耶稣基督已经遗弃了那些不值之人，而且依照诺言，把他们的财宝分给了女人。上帝怜悯弱者，降罪于强者。 <br/> <br/> 男人们，若在某件事上有长处，就过于虚荣，只将自己的行为当作荣耀，竟然连我们的主耶稣基督都忘记了。 <br/> <br/> 所以在我们这世代，妻子、处女、寡妇、都是人格高尚、顺服管教、过最高贵的生活、为男人做表率敬拜天国。女人们蜂拥至教堂，花时间祈祷和听讲道，拒绝娱乐、虚荣和炫耀，对基督的虔诚与敬爱程度之深可是男人们远远比不上的。 <br/> <br/> 妇女们常常关心主所关心，心存敬畏，虔诚到流泪，越发滋长她们对基督的爱。 <br/> <br/> 要我说，女人蒙神的怜悯，显异象，受感化传教，比男人多百倍的恩赐，甚至比祭司也多百倍的恩赐。 <br/> <br/> 因此，预言和与圣灵亲近的恩赐这样的机会，现在似乎常被留给妇女。上帝的伟大奥秘和伟大智慧常向她们显现，正如著名的圣母希尔德加德、圣洁的布里奇特和许多其他已经组成游行队伍的妇女的例子那样。这些我在巴黎、罗马、纽伦堡和布拉格都见过。

Truly no one is outstanding without me, nor fortunate; I embrace all those whose hearts ask for me. He who goes without me goes about in the company of death; and he who bears me will remain lucky for ever. But I stand lower than earth and higher than heaven.
没有我无人杰出，无人幸运；我拥抱所有发自内心求助于我的人。没有我的人与死亡同在，与不幸同行。但我站在低于土地，高于天堂的地方

Remember: Descend from the Gate of Faith between the shadow of the cathedral and the wooden stockade, pass contritely through the dry river bed beneath the great bridge. Like Moses, fearlessly still the waters, ascend to dry land among the bulrushes, find your faith and search in the burning bush.
记住：要从教堂与木制围栏的阴影之间的信仰之门降临，小心翼翼地穿过桥下干涸的河床。就像摩西，无畏地飘过静水，穿过草地，降临旱地，在燃烧的灌木中找到你的信仰。

My Dear Sir, Despite our minor troubles at Pribyslavitz, I must say that everything is proceeding according to plan. I have managed to muster so many men that the losses we have suffered are of little consequence. I believe I will soon succeed in seizing the castle, of which we previously spoke.
尊敬的阁下，我们虽然在普拉比西拉维奇遭受了一点挫折，但局势仍在掌控之中。我成功召集了余部及新兵，我们的损失显得不值一提。我相信我马上就能成功包围城堡，按照我们计划好的办。
Expels from the womb a foetus unwillingly conceived, but may also greatly harm the mother, who by loss of blood expelled from the body along with the foetus may even die.
打掉女人子宫里意外怀上的孩子，但是可能会对母亲造成极大的伤害，会引起大出血甚至失去生命。
Expels from the womb a foetus unwillingly conceived, but may also greatly harm the mother, who by loss of blood expelled from the body along with the foetus may even die.
打掉女人子宫里意外怀上的孩子，但是可能会对母亲造成极大的伤害，会引起大出血甚至失去生命。
Increases strength, but out of drunkenness ties the tongue.
提高力量，但醉酒后舌头就不灵了。
A strong spirit that induces daydreams. Bitter and good for the digestion.
能引起白日梦的强效药剂，味苦且能促消化。
Cures poisoning inflicted by those of evil intent.
解开那些居心不良者下的毒。
Increases agility and stamina, and temporarily firms the arm during archery.
提高敏捷和耐力，短暂地在射击时稳定弓箭。
To steady your hand and sharpen your eye for archery, drink Bowman's Brew and your arrows will find their targets themselves.
稳住你的手，擦亮你的眼睛。喝下射手药剂，你的箭将会自己朝着目标而去。
The slightest amount brings instant death.
最小的剂量就会使人即死。

Whoever shall brew this potion, let him be warned that he is toying with his very soul and with eternal damnation, for anyone who is struck by or imbibes a single drop shall be beyond all help. It is good for hunting bears or poisoning the wells of foes, but beware that it should not come into the wrong hands, for it would give cause for terrible murder. Remember the Lord and do no evil!
要警告那些制作这药剂的人，他可能会永久损坏自己的灵魂，因为触碰到一点或者喝下去一滴的人只能等死。这种药剂适合用于狩猎野熊，或者在敌人的水井里下毒，但是一定要注意这种药剂不能落入坏人手中，否则就会招致灭顶之灾。铭记我主，从善非恶！

Whoever would a good bard be, should drink this potion copiously! It unlocks the jaws and breaks down inhibitions. That the stomach cramps after it and weakness overtakes the body is a price worth paying.
一个好的吟游诗人应该多喝这种药剂！这种药剂会让他无所顾虑地不停说话。尽管它有胃痉挛和身体虚弱的副作用，但还是值得去尝试的。
Increase strength and agility, but you are more easily wounded.
提高力量和敏捷，但是是使用者更容易受伤。
A potion that arouses in men a bloody frenzy, increases strength and effectiveness in battle. Beware, though, should you use it, for a madman in the turmoil of battle may easily come to harm!
这种药剂使人热血沸腾，战力倍增。但是注意，如果你给一个疯子使用了这种药剂，他会更容易在混战中受伤！

He who drinks of this potion shall become dull-witted and be regarded as a fool, for even an ass brays more intelligibly than one who has drunk thistle in wine and then tries to hold wise speech with others.
喝下这种药的人会变得痴呆，被人当成傻瓜，连蠢蛋都比喝了蓟草泡酒的人更会说话。
Relieves a full stomach and stops nausea from bad food.
治疗胃胀，停止变质食物引起的呕吐。

If you have overeaten or overindulged in alcohol, or stuffed yourself like a pig at table and downed rivers of wine, try taking this potion to soothe the stomach and remember next time that he who eats modestly lives long.
如果你把自己吃成了猪，或者千杯下肚，试试用这个药剂帮你疏通肠胃，并且记住细嚼慢咽的人才长寿。
Cures the after-effects of alcohol abuse.
Whoever has overindulged in demon alcohol, let him take this cure to dispel the scourge and sooth his sick head and stomach.
喝醉了的人应该试试这种药剂，可以使人不再头晕想吐。
Dispels fatigue, so you endure for longer without sleep.
去除倦意，使你能熬夜更久。
He whose eyelids are falling and his body ceases to serve him, and yet has before him a long journey, let him drink this potion and restore his energy.
眼皮打架或者疲惫得力不从心，但却前路漫漫任重道远的时候，喝下这种药剂恢复体力吧。
Turns water into blood. Or something that looks like blood.
把水变成血，至少是长得像血的东西……
The charlatan's recipe for turning water into blood. Or something that looks like blood.
江湖郎中（骗子？）给的把水变成血的东西的配方，至少是变得长得像血……
Whoever drinks this potion shall save his game and his soul, and though he should succumb to death, even shall he return to life.
即使死亡已成定局，只要喝了这种酒就可以挽救自己的游戏和灵魂，甚至可以复活。
Restores moderate health, dispels a hangover.
回复中等生命，驱除醉意。

Whoever has been wounded and battered or has bruises and wounds on his body, let him try drinking this potion for recovery. It helps to heal wounds and gives the body the strength to recover. Should it not be enough, though, better to call a physician. It also aids against hangover.
被揍了或是身上带有各种伤口的人可以使用这种药剂来恢复生命值。这种药剂能够治疗伤口，并且加强身体的恢复力。但要是光有它的药效还不够，请及时叫个医生吧。它还可以用来缓解宿醉。
Restores health greatly and dispels certain negative effects.
大量回复生命值，并且驱除负面效果。

A drink that lacks little, for it would raise even the dead from the grave! It gives new strength to the wounded, though they be at death's door. It heals wounds and restores strength even to broken bones. Remember, though, that the potion is not enough and you should still seek the treatment of a physician.
一种几乎完美无缺的药剂，甚至可以使人起死回生！它能把一只脚踏进鬼门关的人拉回来，并为他们注入新的力量。它治疗各种伤口，甚至包括骨折。但是记住，光有这种药还不够，你仍需要医生的救治。

A potion that is not yet very widespread, for it is necessary first to get accustomed to drinking it due to its excessive strength. It drives sickness from the body and warms it on a cold night, but it intoxicates more than wine and the mornings after it are sore.
一种没得到广泛应用的药剂，因为在服用前必须得先习惯它的烈性。它驱除身体的疾病并在寒夜里送来温暖，但它比普通的酒更容易醉，而且喝过的第二天早上可太难受了。
Dogs won't bark at you and horses will love you.
狗不会朝你叫，马会喜欢你。

A recipe from the secret learning of the Arabs, which was used for its success in handling animals, for the smell of the substance has a calming effect on horses and all animals and is so pleasing to dogs that they even forget to bark.
一种阿拉伯人秘传的处方，这药水对付动物很在行，因为其气味能够对马匹和其它所有的动物镇静作用，狗也非常喜欢，当它们嗅到这种气味的时候就不叫了。
Relieves aching joints, so that even the old and grey may canter like spring foals!
舒缓疼痛的关节，让老家伙们也能像小马驹一样蹦跶！
A miraculous elixir to rub on the joints, relieving pain and restoring the suppleness of youth to an infirm body of any age!
一种涂抹在关节上的灵丹妙药，舒缓疼痛，使人返老还童。

The recipe for Musk of Infinite Allure, which Sir Hans wants to take to make him even more irresistable than he already is. It's nothing for me though - I don't really need a horde of admirers following me on stealth missions.
麝香春药的配方，就是那个汉斯·卡蓬大人想搞出来让他更有魅力的药水。当然，对我并没有什么用……在潜行的时候我并不希望我身边有任何“追求者” :)

The recipe for Musk of Infinite Allure, the potion that Sir Hans wants to take to make him even more irresistable than he already is. It's nothing for me though - I don't really need a horde of admirers following me on stealth missions.
麝香春药的配方，就是那个汉斯·卡蓬大人想搞出来让他更有魅力的药水。当然，对我并没有什么用……在潜行的时候我并不希望我身边有任何“追求者” :)
A recipe I got from Brother Nicodemus. It won't miraculously cure anything, but it will fortify health and heal slowly over a long period.
一份从尼可丹姆斯修士那里得到的配方。此配方不会立即治好任何东西，但它会在长时间里慢慢地回复你的生命。
Chamomile brew won't miraculously cure anything, but it will fortify health and heal slowly over a long period.
甘菊煮不会立即治好任何东西，但它会在长时间里慢慢地回复你的生命。
In interaction with the opposite sex gives +30 speech and counteracts the effect of vexation.
使服用者在与异性交流时增加30点口才，驱除烦恼的负面效果。

Ars amatoria or the art of love is learning about matters of love and the affections of the opposite sex. Where talent and attraction are lacking, though, learning cannot help. This potion is always effective against such shortcomings.
爱情的艺术在于研究爱情知识和两性的魅力。然而对于一个天赋和吸引力都缺乏的人来说，就算研究了也无济于事。这种药剂可以帮助克服这种缺缺点。
Not only halts drastic symptoms, but also heals the source of the ailment.
大伤大病和小毛病都能治。
The recipe for the healing potion that should cure the afflicted Merhojed villagers.
能治好莫霍杰德村民的伤痛的药水配方。
Let's you see better in the dark, but light will dazzle you.
让你在黑夜中拥有一双明亮的眼睛，但是亮光会使你眼花缭乱。

He who desires to move in the night like a cat or a bird that flies in the dark, let him brew this potion and drink it in the evening and he will see how the night becomes clearer and more like dusk. Be wary of the light, however, for your eyes will be accustomed to the dark and light will hurt them.
如果有谁想在黑夜中如同猫或者鸟一样自如地行动，就让他熬制这种药剂并且在夜晚喝下它吧，夜晚在他眼中将会像黄昏一样。但是要小心着点儿亮光，因为你的眼睛会习惯天黑，而亮光会灼伤它们。
Induces a muscular rigour that renders the victim incapable of movement. When the rigour has passed, the strength and agility are still afflicted.
使肌肉僵硬，让伤患不能行动。当僵硬消褪以后，力量和敏捷会恢复。

If this decoction comes into contact with anyone's skin, that place will instantly be numbed and incapable of movement. He will stand on the spot like a pillar of salt with no power over his muscles. It is suitable especially for cut wounds, for the patient will no longer feel pain. Beware of giving it to the healthy.
如果这种药剂与任何人的皮肤接触，接触的部位会瞬间麻木、不能行动。他会像盐柱一般立在原地，四肢无力。在处理砍伤上效果非凡，因为病患不会感受到任何痛苦。注意不要把它用在正常人身上。
Whoever wants to poison rats and stray dogs or set bait for prey, let him try this potion. Do not drink it, though, and mark the bottle well, lest anyone else should drink from it!
如果有人想捕鼠和流浪狗或者设置陷阱引诱猎物，他可以试试这种药剂。然而不要喝它，并且标记好瓶子，以防别人喝掉它。
If you are preparing for a long journey and are taking provisions with you, or want to keep food fresh at home for a long time, add to it this potion to make it last longer.
如果你想为长途旅行作准备，随身携带着供给品，或者想在家长时间的保存食物的新鲜品质，你可以给食物加点这种药剂防止它们腐败。
If you want to put to rights the imprudent choices of your life, all it takes is one mouthful, and you can chose your perks anew. Beware, though, the procedure is irreversible and painful!
如果你想重新好好的选择一下你的人生，你只需要和它个一口，然后你就可以重新分配技能点了。注意，这个过程是痛苦而且不可逆的！

Whoever cannot lull themselves or needs to make wounded livestock sleep, let them brew this and they shall have peace. Do not drink it often, though, or it may dull your wits. For a crying child use only half the dose.
无法入眠的人或者想让受伤的牲畜睡觉的人，可以喝下这种药剂获得安眠。然而不要动不动就喝它，否则它会使你痴呆。对于一个嚎啕大哭的孩子，一次半剂就足够了。
Greatly improves the hearing and loosens the feet, so they step more quietly.
增强听力，驱除双脚的负担，让使用者的脚步悄无声息。
Whoever is hard of hearing, has uneven and noisy footsteps and treads heavily, let him brew this to sharpen the ears and loosen the limbs, that he may step quietly as a mouse and lighten his burden.
那些听力虚弱，或者走路困难的人，他们可以喝下这种药剂来增强听力、加速步伐，使他们可以像老鼠一样悄无声息地移动，减轻他们的负担。
Whoever is short of breath or weighed down by heavy armour, let him drink this and he will be less tired!
如果有人已经累得上气不接下气了，或者受不了沉重的盔甲，让他喝下这种药剂然后精神百倍！
Good for a cold or cough and for better humour, as well as for flavouring drinks and improving the taste of sweetmeats.
用于治疗感冒咳嗽，获得好心情，也用于酿制甜水以及改进蜜汁的口味。
It dulls the senses, causes weakness and lowers communication skills.
这种药剂使人精神涣散、暴露弱点，并且舌头打颤。

Whoever does not want to sleep, but would rather rest quietly, let him try brewing this and it will relax his muscles, a state of wellbeing will possess him and give him time to restore his strength. Be wary of using it when amongst people, though, lest they take you for an ass.
如果他不想睡觉，只想安静地闭目养神一会儿，让他喝下这种药剂来放松肌肉，在宁静中慢慢回复体力。然而注意不要在人多的地方使用，以免别人撸你。
Greatly strengthens vitality, temporarily relieves wounds suffered.
大幅增加活力，暂时消除伤痛。
Whoever is disheartened and feels weak, let him drink this for the strengthening of his whole body, for there is no greater herb for stimulation!
任何落魄而虚弱的人可以尝试这种能让他变得精力充沛的药剂，这是最好的兴奋剂了！
Hallucinations, loss of control, unpredictable behaviour.
An old wives' ointment that the witches use in their Sabbaths and thus condemn their souls to Lucifer. Beware of using it, lest you lose control over your body and soul
一种老太婆的软膏，被巫师们在安息日使用过，把他们的灵魂出卖给了路西法。小心使用它，免得失去你自己的身体和灵魂。

On May the fifth, receipt of goods from merchant Olbran of Kourim as follows: fifteen ells of plain cloth, three barrels of salted herring, one sack of salt of one half measure of volume, twelve smoked ham hocks, and two cords of linen wick for the production of candles.</br/></br/>On May the ninth, receipt of gifts intended for the Monastery of Saint Procopius from Sir John Zoula of Vostrzedek and his wife Hedwig. The most noble Sir John, in his great Christian generosity, has bestowed upon the Monastery of Saint Procopius a silver candelabrum of four branches. Lady Hedwig has gifted an exquisite display cabinet constructed of the finest wood. </br/></br/>On May the tenth issued four blocks of pork lard and a bag of salt to the monastery kitchen for the production of scratchings. </br/></br/>

五月十五日，收到商人寇瑞姆的奥尔布兰的货物：十五厄尔的平纹布，三桶盐腌鲱鱼，一袋半量的盐，十二个熏火腿，以及两根用于生产蜡烛的麻绳。</br/></br/> 五月九日，收到沃斯特泽德克的约翰·祖拉阁下及其内人海德薇赠予圣普罗科匹厄斯修道院的礼物。无上尊贵的约翰阁下，慷慨大方地向圣普罗科匹厄斯修道院捐赠了一盏四支银烛灯。海德薇夫人捐赠了一座用上好木材打造的精美陈列柜。</br/></br/>五月十日，向修道院厨房供给了四块猪油以及一袋盐，用以制作炸猪皮片。 </br/></br/>

On May the fifteenth issued to Radana, wife of the Bailiff of Sasau, beeswax and a cord of linen wick for production of candles.</br/></br/>On May the seventeenth receipt of goods from Merchant Vratislav of Kolin. Five ells each of blue atlas and golden brocade, a spool of silver thread, two tailors scissors, one half measure of rare spice, and new engraving tools for Master Engraver Jerome of Silesia.</br/></br/>
五月十五日，向拉达那，莎邵执政官的夫人，提供了蜂蜡和一根亚麻灯芯，以生产蜡烛。 </br/></br/>五月十七日，收到商人科林的弗拉季斯拉夫的货物。五厄尔的蓝色图谱和金色锦缎，一捆银线，两把裁缝剪刀，一多半单位的稀有香料，以及雕刻大师西里西亚的杰罗姆的新雕刻工具。</br/></br/>

On May the twentieth receipt of pigments for decorating the church of Uzhitz. Ochre and azurite in a form ready for the brush, and mineral of cinnabar, which shall be used for making a pigment possessing a red hue. </br/></br/>On May the fourth and twentieth issued to a tailor in Sasau one dozen ells of woollen cloth, for the sewing of new habits for the monks, by cause of some of the aforementioned issuing forth complaints about the ragged state of their garments.</br/></br/>On May the fifth and twentieth receipt of a peculiar payment from Peter Dlouhy of Vlkovetz. Five dozens of eggs, two sacks of flour, one block of pork lard, and eight yards of fuel wood.
五月二十日，收到了粉刷乌兹茨教堂的颜料。赭石和蓝铜矿已可以用于粉刷，还有朱砂矿物，可用于调制具有红色色调的颜料。</br/></br/>五月四日及二十日，由于先前有关于衣服穿破的反映，特向莎邵的一位裁缝提供了十二厄尔的毛料布，为僧侣缝制新衣。</br/></br/>五月五日及二十日，收到了福克维茨的彼得·德罗西的特别供货。五打鸡蛋，两袋面粉，一块猪油和八码燃木。
Have you ever tried hunting those damned overgrown rats? How'd it go? Well, now you know why ermine is so expensive…
为捕鼠忙得焦头烂额？进度如何了？哈，现在你知道为何貂皮如此贵重了吧？

Peace and quiet at home, enough quicksilver, and a surfeit of lead. Now, time to make gold!
家中平静安详，水银足够，铅量过剩。现在，是时候炼金了！

为了响应巨大的需求，这本书包含了100页致力于展示荨麻的作用。

Saddle sores? Riding, you're doing it wrong. Your lower back must move fluidly with the horse's movements; you mustn't wipe your arse with the saddle...
起了马鞍疮？马，不是你那么骑的。你的后腰必须随着马匹的动作协调移动；马鞍可不是用来擦屁股的……

A useful procedure from Poland, where they simply cut around the anus, then after cutting open the abdominal cavity, they continue in the same manner as we do here, except that they then pull the extracted anus through the inside.
一道从波兰传来的工序，他们先切开肛门，然后打开腹腔，到此为止他们的工序跟我们这里的一样，只是他们随后又把余下的肛门从里面掏了出来。

一个移动的身体接触到另一个身体，就会产生摩擦力现象。抵御摩擦力的功会产生热量。

Many tools are not properly sharpened. That’s often because their users don't take the time to maintain them. But to keep things sharp, all you need is a quality whetstone and practice, practice, practice.
许多工具都没被打磨好。主要因为使用者没花时间保养它们。为了把工具打磨好，你只需要一块磨刀石，然后熟能生巧。

It is better to speak with a wise man about something foolish than with a foolish man about something wise. That is, if you are an idiot, stick to what you know.
与一个愚蠢的人谈智慧，不如与一个智慧的人谈蠢事。也就是说，如果你是个白痴，知道多少就说多少。

蜡烛下面的黑影是伟大的。我不知道为什么会有那么多人对此感到吃惊。难道他们藏在烛光底下吗？

When you can't go on anymore, push yourself harder! What could happen? In the worst case scenario, you'll die at the finish line…
如果你坚持不下去了，再逼自己一把！担心什么呢？最不济的情况，也就是死在起跑线上。

Playing die that brings Matthias luck. I heard he carved it himself. From bigger dice.
为马蒂亚斯带来幸运的骰子，我听说这是他自己做的
A playing die made specially for Alfonse.
Dice that belonged to Ambrose, the Sasau tailor, and now maybe to me?
属于安布罗斯，那个莎邵的裁缝，的骰子，现在也许是属于我的了？
Who knows where it came from. It looks like a normal die, but blue.
鬼知道是从哪儿找到的，这个长得像是个普通的骰子，但是是蓝色的。
一个装得特别好的骰子
A die that feels hot to the touch. In place of a one it has a devil's head, which is not something folk like to gaze upon.
一枚炙手的骰子，上面有一颗恶魔的头颅，这可不是什么大家伙儿愿意看到的东西
One of Alfonse's custom-made dice, this one having a devil's head instead of a one.
给阿方瑟定制的骰子之一，这个骰子没有“1”，取而代之的是恶魔的头颅。
Sometimes the dice fall well, sometimes not. This one probably not.
这骰子有时扔得好,有时不好，这次可能是后者。
When fortune smiles on you, smile back. Otherwise you'll look suspicious.
当幸运向你微笑时，你应该以微笑回应。否则你就看起来太可疑了。
The first of the line of demonic dice.
恶魔般的骰子的头一个。
The second in the line of demonic playing dice.
The third and last in the line of demonic dice.
恶魔般的骰子的第三个，也是最后一个。
A playing die someone tried to load to their advantage, but they didn't do a very good job.
一个被人动过手脚的骰子，但是并没有什么卵用。
A playing die that brings luck more often than you'd expect.
骰子会给你带来意想不到的好运气。
A blessed playing die consecrated to the Holy Trinity in the hope of falling on three.
一个被眷顾的骰子，被圣三一所保佑以容易掷出数字3
Playing die loaded in favour of even numbers.
Playing die loaded in favour of odd numbers.
喜欢奇数的人玩的骰子
A miraculous playing die, sent from the Heavenly Kingdom to the kingdom of men.
一个神奇的骰子，被从天国带到人间。
A playing die that Henry secretly made to bring him luck in love, which is why he'd rather not use it to gamble with.
亨利的一个骰子，暗中邦亨利增加桃花运，这也是为什么他不用这个骰子赌。
A playing die that you'd be better off throwing as far away as possible.
这骰子你扔得越远越好！
Legend has it that dice can strip more than one maiden.
传说掷骰子游戏能让不止一个少女脱下衣服
One of the few properly loaded dice, loaded in favour of its holder.
很少的几个适手的骰子之一，依使用者的喜好而配置。
The spurs are proof of conquest of the encampment.
这个马镫是打败这个营地的证据。
The mask is a proof of conquest of the encampment.
这张面具是征服营地的证明。
A book in which the Abbot and Prior keep records about the monastery novices.
一本由院长和长老记录关于见习修道士的报告。
A remedy for staying awake, in large quantities.
一大袋治疗睡不着的药
Antlers - a trophy as well as a tool for everyday use and an ingredient of herbal potions.
鹿茸-是狩猎得到的战利品，也是一种日常使用的工具和草药的一种成分。
An apple a day keeps the apothecary away. It's not terribly nutritious, but stays fresh a long time.
每天一苹果，郎中远离我。虽然不是特别有营养，但能保鲜很久。
It would be better in a pie, but beggars can't be choosers.
要是在馅饼里就更好了，但是要饭的哪能挑肥拣瘦。
Tart and chewy, it won't fill you much, but it'll take the fur off your tongue when you're hungover.
又酸又有嚼劲，它不会让你吃得太饱，但会在你宿醉时不会太恶心。
Aprons are worn as a protective outer layer of clothing, useful when cooking as well as for keeping warm.
裙板是衣服的外层防护，不仅在做饭时能派上用场，而且能保暖。
A large armour repair kit containing a hammer, pliers, replacement mail, rivets and wire.
一大包盔甲修理工具，包含一个锤子，一个钳子，还有一些用于替换的锁子，柳钉和麻绳。

There are many types of arrows available to medieval archery - wounding and piercing arrows for combat, hunting arrows for shooting game etc. They can all vary in quality too, and a good bow won't shoot bad arrows well, or vice versa.
中世纪箭术中有许多种不同的箭头可供使用——穿刺箭用来战斗，狩猎箭用来射击游戏等等。他们在质量上也参差不齐，一把好弓射不出坏箭，反之亦然。
Marked arrow for use in games
在比赛中做了标记的箭。
Fine quality steel, nothing shoddy about it.
优质钢铁，没一点劣质成分。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Axe<br/><br/>A battleaxe of the highest quality. The blade will endure many blows and cut through even strong plate armour, and the handle will take even the most powerful blows of enraged foes. Demands respect in all circumstances.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 斧子 <br/><br/> 品质最高的战斧。斧刃能承受很多次挥砍，能砍穿重甲，握把能承担暴怒敌人的最强攻击。在任何时候都要对其保持敬畏

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Axe<br/><br/>A traditional tool that can also be used for combat. Compared to a sword, the axe has greater impact and is thus suited to the dealing with heavily armoured opponents. But it's heavier and therefore slower and, above all, doesn't give much cover, especially if the axe was originally intended for work and doesn't have a metal-plated handle.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 斧子 <br/><br/> 传统用具,也可以用来战斗，与剑,斧相比有更大的冲击,因此适合于对付重装的对手。因重量较重，所以会导致行动变慢，且最重要的是,它并不提供什么防护，主要是这把斧头最初是用于工作和没有经过镀金处理

A ring named after the Greco-Roman god of feasting and merrymaking. It's a bauble of little value in itself, but whoever has it will have everything paid for them at the tavern by Kuno. Naturally, the merry men are very keen to get their hands on it, by hook or by crook.
这个指环是通过一位希腊-罗马神话的婚宴之神来命名的，他虽然自己没有什么价值，但是拥有它的人会在酒馆的库诺那里得到所有奖赏。自然而然的，新郎会非常想拥有他，合法地或者非法地。
Fine smoked bacon, filling and pleasing.
一块不错的熏猪肉，令人满足，令人愉悦。
Originally for the wages owed to the miners at the Talmberg quarry, but now you can share it with Fritz and Matthew.
起初是应给塔尔木堡采石场旷工的工钱，但现在你可以和德国佬和马修一起分了它。
Sharing your money is good for your soul. Damn it!
分享你的财富能升华你的灵魂。干！

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Mace<br/><br/>A bailiff's mace, an instrument of justice, capable of meting it out. Its heavy ornamented head demands respect, both on the battlefield and off of it.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 钉头锤 <br/><br/> 执政官的权杖因能伸张正义，是正义的媒介。不管是否在战场上，它沉重的装饰头都理应得到尊重
Strip of clean linen used to stop bleeding.
用于止血条干净的亚麻布条。
A hacked-off bandit's ear. The ear is hacked off, that is - the bandit is probably dead.
被割下的强盗的耳朵。耳朵都被割下来了，那肯定能证明这哥们儿死了。
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Polearm<br/><br/>A sturdy, heavy weapon with a wide blade on a massive pole that can scatter enemies with a wide sweep.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长杆兵器 <br/><br/> 一把坚固的月牙形刀刃的重型武器，巨大的杆身能轻松用横扫击散敌人
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Axe<br/><br/>A battle axe with a metal-plated handle. A nimble battle axe that can pierce most armour with a metal-plated handle that can stop many a blow.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 斧子 <br/><br/> 一种有镀金把手的战斧，它灵敏度的高且能穿透绝大多数盔甲，加之镀金把手能挡下许多攻击
A wooden cross I found at the heretics' assembly place.
我在异教徒聚集地发现的木十字架
来自作家的书房的钥匙
A prime beef cut, packed with nutrition but a little heavy on the digestion.
一块极好的牛肉，富含营养但有些不易消化。
Fine tender beef from a well-fed heifer. Who could resist?
又有谁能抵得住小肥牛身上柔嫩多汁牛肉的诱惑？
Chewy and full of flavour. Can be kept anywhere - in your purse, under a rock, in a hole in a tree...
味道丰富有嚼劲。可以在任何地方保存——放在你的包里、石头下、树洞里……
Looks like leather and about as chewy, but a bit more nutritious.
看起来像块皮子，也差不多有嚼劲，但是更有营养一些。
Liquid bread, a satisfying drink that also fills the belly. Don't overdo it, lest you succumb to alcoholism.
液体面包,一种称心的饮料，能填饱肚子。不要喝太多，免得你变成酒鬼。
A cold one for a hothead.
Beer recipe stolen from the Uzhitz innkeeper.
从旅馆老板乌兹茨那偷来的啤酒配方。
Beet can be eaten even raw. It's really healthy.
甜菜甚至可以吃生的。真的很健康。
Beet is a healthy and nutritious root vegetable, whether raw or cooked.
甜菜是一种无论是生吃还是煮熟都健康的且有营养的根菜,。
A wineskin filled with chicken blood.
The Italian bill is a long, light, fast weapon, useful for pulling a rider off of his horse.
意大利勾镰枪是一种长型、轻型且攻击速度快的武器，可把骑手拉下马。
抓住了一只夜莺的捕鸟器
Black feathers from a black bird, maybe a raven, maybe a chicken.
黑色羽毛！来自黑色鸟类身上，可能是乌鸦的，也可能是鸡的。
A pitcher of ale for Father
The ring you gave to Bianca.
Gently spiced meat from a boar with an unmistakeable taste.
Boar-hunting is a dangerous pursuit, so boar meat on the table is a demonstration of strength, bravery and a well-deserved reward.
猎杀野猪是一种危险的举动，所以餐桌上的野猪肉是力量与勇气证明，也是当之无愧的奖赏。
A poachers' speciality, to stave off the hunger in winter.
偷猎者的最爱，过冬必备。
Gently spiced, smoked boar meat has a strong, unmistakeable flavour.
微辣的烟熏野猪肉有种强烈的、难以错认的味道。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Polearm<br/><br/>A polearm used for both combat and hunting. It's rather ridiculous name was derived from two protruding lugs below the point, which prevented the weapon from piercing too deep into the flesh of the enemy (or prey) and allowed it to be quickly pulled out for further strikes.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长杆兵器 <br/><br/> 一把用来战斗和打猎用的长柄武器。这有点可笑的名字取自它那尖端下两个突出的耳朵，用来防止刺入敌人或猎物身体太深，以便快速拔出继续进攻
The key to the church steeple.
An estimable fruit of the Bohemian lands, tasty boiled or roasted, with meat or porridge.
波西米亚生长的珍贵菌类，煮熟或者烘烤，搭配肉类或者白粥，都极美味。
Mushrooms grow overnight and spoil almost as fast, so drying them is a good idea.
蘑菇一晚上就能长出来，但也腐败的很快，所以风干是一种不错的储存方式。
A finger bone. The Lord alone knows if this is the relic of a saint or the earthly remains of some poor wretch.
一块指骨。只有领主自己知道这是一个圣人的遗物还是某个可怜人的残骸。
A transcription of the preaching of Master Jan Hus made by Father Godwin, the Uzhitz parish priest.
乌兹茨教区的神父戈德温据强·胡斯大师的弥撒所做的抄本。
Masterfully crafted shoes of the finest leather. Very comfortable and fashionable footwear.
这种鞋子设计巧妙且采用最好的皮革制成，即舒适又时尚
Low shoes come in all shapes and sizes in the 15th century. These slippers have quite extravagant points, a feature of footwear that is currently in vogue.
十五世纪的时，各式各样的低帮鞋流行起来，这些便鞋有一个很浮夸的尖头，至今这种设计仍很时髦。
The key to the locked charcoal-burners' shack.
A bow with enough power to comfortably take down any game animal. And if it will fell a 200 pound stag, a lightly armoured enemy doesn't stand much chance against it.
弓的力量足够轻松猎下任何狩猎动物。如果它能击败200磅的牡鹿,那么轻装甲的敌人根本不是它的对手。
Adam the alehouse boy's bow. It doesn't have a lot of range or power, but almost anyone is capable of drawing it. Watch out, nests!
酒屋小子亚当的弓，威力不大，但几乎任何人都能拉动。小心点，你们！
An extremely powerful longbow that also demands extreme strength to draw.
一把威力极大的弓，也需要极大的力量才能将其拉开。
An ordinary bow made by someone handy at whittling and with the right kind of wood at hand. Don't be fooled - even a home-made bow can be deadly in the hands of an experienced archer.
一把普通的弓，由一个手巧的人在手边刚好有合适的木头时削制成的。别被它迷惑了——哪怕是一把自制弓放在有经验的弓箭手上都会变得致命
An ornamented branch that is placed by craftsmen on the frame of a house when the roof is ready to be constructed.
一个装饰过的树枝，是开始建造屋顶前，工匠放在房子框架上的。
A quarter-loaf of local bread. It's filling and when dried remains edible for many days.
四分之一条本地面包。能填饱肚子，放很多天变干了也能吃。
A plaited, crusty white bread roll, smells wonderful and tastes just as good.
一种打褶的、有硬壳的白面包卷，吃到嘴里就像闻起来那样，味道极好！
The bridle is a leather harness mounted on the horse's head to give the rider better control of his steed, which is needed not only for general riding, but also for mounted combat or flight.
马笼头是一种装在马头上用于给骑手更好地控制战马的马具革，不仅仅适用于平常骑乘，也适于战斗或撤退。
An accessory to brigandine armour that protects the combatant's shoulder.
保护战士肩膀的鳞甲配件。
Originally forged by Master Ota Rabstein for the Sasau Bailiff.
原是奥塔·拉布施泰因大师为莎邵的执政官锻造的
The brigandine is a type of armour made of small steel plates riveted to a stiff, tough fabric or leather lining. The segmentation of the armour gives the wearer greater mobility.
这鳞甲是一种由许多小金属板构成的盔甲，给穷光蛋用的，布料和皮内里都很粗糙。盔甲分成小块，给予了穿着者更大的活动性。

Brigandine with cuisses crafted by the finest Imperial armourers. The plates are riveted on a thick layer of brightly red leather. A knight in this brigandine is the flower of contemporary chivalry just like any other member of the Order.
帝国最好的军械师花大心思制作的带腿甲的鳞甲。金属板上铆接了一层厚厚的亮红皮革。穿这种鳞甲的骑士就像其他武士团的成员一样是当代骑士精神之花。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Axe<br/><br/>A battle axe with a broad head and metal-plated handle. The heavy head of this axe endows every blow with a power that many types of armour cannot stand up to, and its metal-plated handle can fend off many a blow.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 斧子 <br/><br/> 带渡金属的把手的宽头战斧，其极有分量的头部赋予每一击的力量都是几乎没有几种盔甲可以抵挡的，镀金属的把手也能起到防御作用
A woven silk fabric, popular among the wealthy classes for its colourful, highly detailed pattern.
一种丝绸织物，因色彩鲜艳，图案精细在富人阶层中很受欢迎

The chainmail collar or mantle, called a pixane, protects one of the combatant's most vulnerable body parts - the neck. It is usually worn as a component of mail armour and with a helmet not fitted with an aventail, though it's also sometimes worn by lightly-armoured soldiers over a gambeson without other body armour.
链甲肩套或者斗篷，统称为锁子甲披肩，用来保护战士身体上最脆弱的部分之一—脖子，它通常作为链甲的一部分与头盔一起佩戴，但不能和护面搭配，偶尔有些没穿其他盔甲，只穿了软甲士兵也会佩戴它。
A mail coif is a hood covering the head, neck and shoulders with chainmail. In combat it provides very good protection of vulnerable spots.
廉价头巾是一种带有铁链的，能遮住头，脖子，肩膀的风帽。它在战斗中提供很好的防护。

Coif made of the finest steel mesh. Wide collar protects otherwise very vulnerable neck. Together with the helmet and other parts of the full suit of armour it covers the body as to make it virtually invulnerable to most attacks.
头巾由最好的钢丝网制成。宽领能够保护异常脆弱的脖子，戴上头盔、穿上这套盔甲的其他部分就能让大多数攻击无效。

Chainmail coats and vests are made from small metal rings linked together into a mesh. They differ in the size and shape of the rings as well as the linking system. The rings are usually riveted closed. Chainmail provides good protection against slashing, but can be pierced fairly easily and without a layer of padding provides almost no defence against blunt, crushing blows.
锁子甲外套和背心是由小金属环连在一起制成的网眼织物。它们的大小、形状和连接系统各不相同，通常是铆接的。锁子甲可以很好地保护你不被砍伤，但是很容易被刺穿，而且没有内衬几乎不能防止钝器的粉碎打击。

Chainmail made of thousands of the finest steel rings. It must have been devilishly difficult to make, but this fine mesh will reliably stop most attacks. The mail covers especially the spots that cannot be protected by plates, like armpits. A real jewel of the armourer's craft. The armour is emblazoned with silver monogram WH.
锁子甲由千万个最佳的钢环组成。很难制作，这些精制的网眼能够有效的抵挡大多数攻击。盔甲覆盖了那些钢板无法保护到的区域，比如腋下。真是盔甲工艺中一件难能可贵的珍品。盔甲上镶嵌了银质的WH字母。
Cabbage is a common ingredient of meals - and a healthy one at that!
卷心菜是一种常见食材——一种很健康的食材！
Cooked cabbage is a staple of medieval cuisine. Few dishes do not contain cabbage.
煮白菜是中世纪的主要菜肴。几个菜不包含卷心菜
An overcoat of Oriental style, both in cut and ornamentation.
一种在剪裁和选饰方面都有极具东方色彩的外套。
The coif is a small cap, usually worn under a helmet or hat, but can also be worn alone.
头巾是一种简单的帽子，通常是垫在头盔下面做内衬的，但是也可以就戴它。

The caparison is an ornamental cape for a horse, which brings the owner distinction and admiration and flaunts his social status. Imagine the embarrassment if two knights turned up at a tournament with horses dressed in the same caparison. Scandal!
马衣是给马匹用的装饰性披风，给拥有者带来荣誉和钦佩并能炫耀其社会地位。想象一下两个骑士骑着穿同款马衣的马出现在赛场上的尴尬场面。囧！
Key from the barn holding the Cuman.
关押库曼人的仓库的钥匙
A fine hunting bow you won in a wager with Lord Capon.
和卡蓬少爷打赌赢得的一把上好的猎弓。
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Mace<br/><br/>A captain's mace, an instrument of justice, capable of meting it out.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 钉头锤 <br/><br/> 指挥官权杖，因它能申张正义，是正义的媒介
Key from the barn in Merhojed.
位于莫霍杰德的谷仓的钥匙
I found this letter on the captive bandit in Merhojed.
我在莫霍杰德那被俘获的强盗身上发现的这封信。
A root vegetable, healthy, juicy, and sweet. Good in soups and mash. Can be eaten raw as well.
一种有益于身体健康的、多汁的且清甜的蔬菜，用来做汤或做成糊都很美味，还可以生吃。
It gets tender and sweet when cooked. You can add it to other foods or just eat it on its own.
煮熟后，它变得又软又甜，能与其它食物混着吃也能单独吃。
会给你带来好运，但这也不一定。
Flowers picked from the grave of the restless dead man.
从那些不能安息的亡者坟上采来的花。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Mace<br/><br/>A ceremonial mace is a symbol of military status, which is not to say that it's a mere fashion accessory - it serves just as well as a weapon and the heavy head can put serious dents in an opponent's armour... or head.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 钉头锤 <br/><br/> 仪仗是军事地位的象征，所以不能单纯的作为时尚配件——它能像武器一样使用，沉重的柄头能对敌人的盔甲或头部造成严重的损伤
Tailor's kit containing patching fabric, a needle and thread and scissors.
裁缝的工具箱，包含一些布料，一根针和一根线，还有一把剪刀。
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Mace<br/><br/>A primitive weapon good for straightening out disobedient stableboys or chasing off thieves, but not a lot of use against armoured opponents.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 钉头锤 <br/><br/> 一把适用于纠正不听话的马夫或追逐小偷的原始武器，但是用来对付披甲的敌人没有什么用
A piece of charred wood from the burnt-out farm of the deceased Alois. Should help in dispelling his ghost.
已故的阿洛伊斯的被大火烧毁的农场里的一块烧焦的木头。应该可以用来驱散他的鬼魂。
Coffee is not available in the Dark Ages.
A sack pulled out from the stash behind the charcoal-burners' house. It's full of Groschen, but contains no jewels.
一个从烧炭工房子后面取出来的袋子。一袋满满的格罗申，缺没有一点珠宝。
A ring acquired from the executioner, who got it from a dead man.
刽子手从一个死人那里得来的一个戒指
A nobleman's light outer jacket, worn more for ornament than practical function.
一种贵族穿的轻便的短上衣，多用于装饰没什么实用功能
A plain chemise, an undergarment commonly worn by women.
普通的衬衣，通常是女性穿的内衣
A woman's dress of fine fabric, demonstrating that the wearer belongs to the cream of town society.
质地上乘的女装，证明了穿着者是城市社会的精英
A common or garden woman's dress. No fancy colours, patterns or expensive material.
一种普通的女装。没有鲜艳的颜色，没有精美的图案，也没有昂贵的材料。
A woman's dress suitable for everyday wear.
An ornamented woman's dress for special occasions, tailor-made in Rattay.
只会在过节才穿的节日用裙子，由拉泰裁缝制作
The cow's tongue is a piece of very lean meat.
牛舌是一块非常瘦的肉
From the cow's mouth to yours, a delicacy even the less wealth can afford.
牛嘴里的东西跑到你嘴里去了？这是只有少数富人才买得起得美味。
What could be better than freshly roasted pork cracklings? Especially with a tankard of ale.
还有什么比新鲜出炉的烤猪肉脆皮配上一大杯啤酒更美妙吗？
Cream has always been a luxurious additive to sauces, whether sweet or savoury.
奶油始终当做酱汁的一种奢侈添加剂，甜美又可口。
This fine cross-guard was engraved in Sasau.
这个上好的剑格在莎邵刻成。
Crystal meth is not available in Dark Ages. Let's cook!
黑暗时代可没有这玩意儿。一起来制毒吧！
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Axe<br/><br/>A small, but versatile battle axe much used by Cuman troops.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 斧子 <br/><br/> 一种小型的，但用途广泛的战斧，多用在库曼军队中
Cuman riding boots, offering just the right mix of comfort and protection.
库曼马靴，既舒适又起到了保护的作用。
The Cuman bow is quite short in length, making it more suitable for use on horseback. The recurve shape - double curve - compensates for the power loss of the shorter length.
库曼弓因弓身较短，使其更适合在马背上使用。其反曲的形状，补偿了因为弓身短而损失的力量。
Cuman wool cap, due to its distinctive colour and shape much loved by Talmberg archers.
库曼的羊毛帽，由于它独特的颜色和形状，在塔尔木堡的弓箭手中十分流行。
An ear I cut from a Cuman. Sir Robard will pay six score Groschen for it.
一个从库曼人身上切下来的耳朵。罗巴德大人会按每个耳朵六块钱打赏我。
A special kind of protection - a leather strap with metal components, a favourite of Cuman horsemen.
一种特殊防护--带金属组件的皮带，库曼骑手的最爱
Cuman helmet modified to match accounts of barbarians.
库曼人为了与他们野蛮人的名声相配做的改良头盔。
A Cuman helmet adapted to match the accounts of the barbarians.
一种据野蛮人战利品的数量来调整自身的库曼头盔
Cuman armour modified to match accounts of barbarians.
库曼人为了与他们野蛮人的名声相配做的改良盔甲。
Cuman armour modified to match accounts of barbarians.
库曼人的盔甲改成了野人的样子
Cuman chainmail; it provides good protection against slashing and chopping attacks.
库曼链甲；它能在面对鞭打与砍击是提供很好的防护。
Cuman chainmail reinforced in places where the combatant is most vulnerable; it offers lasting protection against slicing and chopping blows.
库曼锁甲把战士的最薄弱部分全部加强，还能对切与砍的攻击提供持续的防护。
Riding hose of loose cut for easy mounting and dismounting.
便于上下山的宽松式样骑马用紧身裤
A short jacket. Its vibrant colour indicates that it has been sewn from quite luxurious material.
短夹克。它明快的颜色表明它是用名贵的布料缝制的。

Shishak or chichak is a type of helmet used in Eastern Europe, usually of a conical shape rising to a point, with cheek pieces, sometimes with a chain-mail neck guard - aventail. Some, especially those worn by commanders, are fitted with anthropomorphic faceplates.
奇恰克是一种在东欧流行的头盔。它大体呈椭圆形，有一只尖角，并且加带着颊革和护颈，因此也被称作龙虾角。有些头盔尤其是指挥官戴的配有拟人化面板。

The commander's helmet is distinguished by its full, anthropomorphic faceplate. The marauding hordes can easily identify their leader by it and it serves to strike fear into the heart of the enemy. It also amply protects the head from enemy attack, including from arrows.
库曼面部防护指挥官的头盔的特点是全脸式且拟人面部化的头盔，巡逻的士兵们可以通过这个来认出指挥官，并且有惊吓敌兵的用处。还能在遭受敌人攻击时充分保护头部。
A long under-tunic of the Cuman type. Fashioned from several layers of fabric, it offers basic protection in combat.
库曼式的长袍，由好几层纤维手工制成，能在战斗中提供基础防御。
Cuman type vambraces (forearm guard). Useful in archery as well as close-quarter combat.
库曼人的护臂，在射箭和近战时十分有效。
A document commissioning a band of mercenaries to patrol the woods of Sasau and keep watch for Cumans.
一纸文书命令一群雇佣兵在莎邵的林子巡逻，防御库曼人

The dagger cannot be equipped, but you can use it to kill in stealth mode if you have it in your inventory.
 
The dagger is the knife's more dangerous cousin. Most of the time it is used for slicing cheese or apples, because in combat it is not much use against longer weapons. However, it comes in very handy if you need to creep up on someone and dispose of them without attracting attention.

匕首并不能被装备，但只要它在你身上，你就可以用它暗杀别人。
 
匕首的刀是更危险的，大部分时间用于切片奶酪或苹果,因为在战斗中不能对抗长武器。然而,如果你需要悄悄靠近某人并在没有引起人们注意的情况下处理他们，它能派上大用处。
A dead hen. She didn't know what hit her.
一只死母鸡。她不知道自己是怎么死的。
No one is likely to recognise the bird in this state.
这样的鸡没人认得出来。
White meat or red meat, it's all brown now.
不管之前白肉还是红肉，现在都是“棕”肉了。
This is a really heavy item. Really. Heavy.
这是一件很重的物品。真的···很重！
A dagger ornamented for ritual purposes.
仪式的匕首装饰的目的
An official deed proving claim to land whose ownership is in dispute.
一种证明所有权受争议的土地所属的官方契据
Venison from a deer of one kind or another.
Keeps well and is easier to hide from the prying eyes of the local gamekeeper.
保存良好，很容易逃避猎场看守人的法眼。
There's something odd about this die, but I'm not sure what.
这个骰子有些奇怪，但我又说不出哪里奇怪。
About how the Maidens' War began.
讲述捷克女性起义的开始。
About how the Maidens' War ended.
讲述捷克女性起义的尾声。
Roe-deer venison will add variety to your diet and put hair on your chest.
獐鹿肉会丰富你的食谱并使你长胸毛。
A nice lean piece of roe-deer venison will make your mouth water.
一块精瘦獐鹿肉会让你流口水
The huntsman's staple while stalking prey.
这是猎人们的主要目标。
That deer has been smoked. Twice.
这头鹿是被烟熏过的。两次噢。
Dog lard, suitable for frying horse sausages. Or for rubbing on your chest when you've got a cough.
狗油，适合煎马肉香肠。或者用来在咳嗽的时候涂抹在你的胸口。
Meat from a cute doggie. Slice, salt, fry - delicious!
一只可爱小狗的肉。切片，撒上盐，过油炸，十分美味！
Lightly spiced dog meat fills the belly and will satisfy even a demanding gourmet.
用只加少量调味品的狗肉填饱肚子后，连挑剔的美食家都会感到满足。
Some dogs are more useful in this form.
有些狗还是这个样子比较有用。
Still man's best friend, but a lot quieter now.
依然是人们最好的朋友，不过现在安静多了。
A nicely ornamented ring the widow Drahomira gave me for helping with the ghost.
寡妇德侯米娅给我用来驱鬼的一个精美的饰戒
Dried fruit is a delicacy, yet all you have to do to make it is slice some fruit you like and leave it to dry in the sun. Good to carry with you on long journeys.
水果干，但你制作它只需把你喜爱的水果切片，然后留给太阳晒干。长途旅行的必备佳品。
Dried mushrooms on their own don't make much of a meal, but they're excellent for adding flavour to foods, especially soups.
蘑菇干虽然并不能单独作为菜肴，但可以给食物添加风味，尤其是汤。
Offal is innards, used mainly in cooked dishes. Also sometimes uses as bait.
内脏主要用来做菜，也可用作诱饵。
Cooked offal makes a good snack and is great for stuffing a roast or adding to soup.
熟内脏是一种好吃的小食，不管是填充在烤肉里，还是加在汤里，都极美味！
A quarter of roast duck will fill you up nicely.
四分之一的烤鸭够你饱餐一顿了！
How two Pontiffs fought over the Papal throne and what it meant for Christendom.
讲述两位教皇如何为了基督教世界争夺教会权力
Dried human ear. Reminds one of grandma.
风干了的人耳！让我想起了一位祖母
A horse is a large joint of meat, enough for several meals.
一匹马的肉很多，够吃好几顿。
There's nothing quite as juicy and nutritious as a nicely cooked slab of horse meat.
再没什么东西能比精心制作的一片厚马肉更多汁营养的了。
If you must slaughter a horse, then drying it will ensure the meat doesn't go to waste.
如果你非要杀一匹马的话，风干它可以保证肉不被浪费。
Even butchered and smoked, your horse can still sustain you on long journeys.
就算被屠宰、被烟熏，你的马依旧可以助你远行。
It's not advisable to carry raw eggs into battle with you. Things could get messy.
把生鸡蛋带到战场上去可不是明智的选择。事情可能会变得很混乱。
The breakfast of champions and easier to carry in your pouch than a raw one.
赢家的早餐，生的比熟的更容易带在口袋里
Even an empty sack can come in useful, at least for drowning kittens.
即使是空麻袋也能派上用场，至少能用来淹死小猫。
A piece of parchment and a stick of charcoal for writing.
一张羊皮纸和一根木炭，可以写字。
A rotten executioner's rope Executioner Hermann gave me to switch for the Kuttenberg Executioner's rope.
一个腐烂的刽子手的绳子。刽子手赫曼用它和我交换库腾堡刽子手的绳子。
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>An executioner's sword, made to cut the heads off of convicted criminals.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 刽子手的剑，被用来斩下罪犯的首级。
A bolt of the finest brocade stolen from the tailor.
从裁缝那偷来的一匹最好的织锦。
A hat with quite an extravagant look for the 15th century, made from finest felt and dyed in strong colours.
这种帽子的样式对十五世纪这个年代来说颇为大胆，选用上好的毡毛制造且用色浓烈。
The sword my father made for Sir Radzig Kobyla.
这把剑是我父亲为拉德季·科比拉造的。
Key from Master Feyfar's trunk in the siege camp.
能打开费法大人在攻城营地的箱子的钥匙。
Felt hats are popular for their malleability. Everyone's hat can be unique!
毛毡帽因为它的可塑性而流行。每个人的帽子都不同！
The most primitive form of medieval footwear - a piece of leather fastened around the foot with a strap over cloth wraps, which were the precursor to socks.
中世纪最原始的“鞋”，仅仅由一片皮子缠在脚上，用布固定，可以看作是袜子的祖先。
Comfortable knight gambeson commonly used as a lower layer under a heavier armour. It is adorned with monogram WH in silver thread to stress its owner's social status.
舒适的骑士软甲，穿在更重的盔甲的里一层，用银线缝的字母“WH”做装饰，代表着所有者的社会地位。
Key to the trunk containing the dice tournament prize.
打开放有比武大会奖励的箱子的钥匙。
Garlic, adds flavour and will heal any ailment as well as seasoning many dishes. But raw it burns the tongue.
大蒜、调味会治愈任何疾病以及许多菜肴调味料。但生吃会伤舌头
Burns when raw, but on the contrary is sweet when cooked. Good for seasoning many foods.
生吃难受,煮熟后却美味。适于为多种食物调味。
Gauntlets provide the best protection for the combatant's hands. It's sensible to remove them before picking your nose.
护手提供对战士的手最佳保护。鼓掌时建议摘掉。
Plate gauntlets encased in red leather. They are made in the so-called hourglass manner, which ensures both a high degree of protection and articulation of the wrist.
板甲护手由红皮革包裹。它们以所谓的“沙漏方式”制造，能够在它保持高度防御状态下操纵。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Polearm<br/><br/>A long, light weapon suitable against mounted combatants and foot soldiers, especially if they are unarmoured. But the light wood of the shaft won't withstand much.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长杆兵器 <br/><br/> 一把轻型长剑适于对付无盔甲的骑兵和步兵。但是轻木柄并不太耐用
Soft deerskin gloves. Provide basic hand protection.
软鹿皮手套，提供最基本的手部防御。
Give that cross back, you thieving bastard. <br/> <br/> Signed INRI
你这个混账小偷，把金十字还给我！ <br/> <br/> Signed INRI
黄金的杯子用来装圣酒。
100% gold and heavy. Maybe edible, maybe not.
百分百纯金制成，还挺有分量（挺重的）的。也许可以吃？
A sweet pancake made of milk, flour and eggs.
甜煎饼是由牛奶，面粉和鸡蛋做的。
<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Polearm<br/><br/>A hooked polearm. No mounted combatant - armour or no armour - can stay in the saddle after being struck by a guisarme.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长杆兵器 <br/><br/> 一种带钩的长杆兵器。任何一个骑兵，不管穿没穿盔甲，都会被长钩刀从马上给拽下来
Hagen Zoul's helmet is light, yet unusually strong. Truly a fine piece of craftsmanship.
佐尔的头盔虽然很轻，但是非常坚硬。一个完美工匠精神的最佳体现
The House of Zoul cuirass is firmly bound to the family waffenrock and finely ornamented with a knight's belt. The cuirass is light, but very strong and will surely endure many blows.
佐尔家族的胸甲牢固地绑在制服上，并且与骑士的腰带贴合的很完美。尽管很轻，但仍十分坚固并且能抵挡多次攻击。
A message found at the raided farm. I should deliver it to Sir Radzig without delay.
在一个被打劫过的农场找到的信息。我应该立即把告诉给拉吉克先生。
Plate armour to protect the thighs, knees and calves. In addition to being richly ornamented, it is exceptionally strongly rivetted and finely articulated.
腿甲的装甲板能够保护大腿，膝盖和小腿。它不仅被丰富的装饰，而且被不同寻常的坚硬的，完美的铰接和铆接工艺处理过。
Arm plate that protects the shoulder and arm, including a pauldron, rerebrace, couter and vambrace. It is exceptionally strongly rivetted and finely articulated.
肩甲通过上肩甲，大臂甲，手臂铰接处的甲和小臂甲组合而成，能够保护肩膀和手臂。这款肩甲通过完美而强硬的铆接和铰接处理而成

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Polearm<br/><br/>A universal polearm suitable against infantry and cavalry. Its head features both an axe blade, a spike and a hook, making it ideal for unhorsing cavalry.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长杆兵器 <br/><br/> 一种适合对付步兵和骑兵的常见长柄武器。它的前端有斧刃，尖刺和钩子，是下马的骑兵的理想武器
A marked hammer. It says "Samopesh - property of the smithy".
一个有标记的锤子，上面写道：萨莫培什--铁匠铺的财产
An illustrated book owned by Sir Hanush.
Meat from a wild hare is healthy and delicate. But a hare isn't very big and won't keep you fed for long.
健康野兔身上细腻的肉。但是野兔很小，吃完很快就会饿。
Cooked meat from a wild hare is white and delicate, like chicken.
熟野兔肉是一种与鸡肉相似的清淡可口的白肉
There's not much meat on a hare, even less when it's dried, but at least it'll keep longer.
一只兔子身上没多少肉，风干之后就更少了，但至少这样能保存得更久些。
Hare meat is delicate, lean and healthy. When smoked, it makes a good snack to take on your travels.
野兔肉清淡而不肥腻，十分健康。烟熏之后会成为旅行必备的好零食。
The fluffy tail of a forest hare, brutally hacked off. How could you, you monster?
一个毛茸茸的，被残忍拔掉的，森林野兔的尾巴。你这个怪兽，你怎么能这样！
A hat keeps off the sun and rain, but gives little protection against anything more forceful.
一种可遮光且能挡雨的帽子，但是基本没有任何防护能力。
A hat keeps off the sun and rain, but gives little protection against anything more forceful.
一种可以抵挡射入的阳光的帽子，但是不能抵挡比阳光强的东西。
A hat keeps off the sun and rain, but gives little protection against anything more forceful.
这种帽子可以抵挡日照和雨淋，但任何强于日晒雨淋的东西都会使它的功效大大减弱。
A hat keeps off the sun and rain, but gives little protection against anything more forceful.
这种帽子可以抵挡日照和雨淋，但任何强于日晒雨淋的东西都会使它的功效大大减弱。
A hat keeps off the sun and rain, but gives little protection against anything more forceful.
这种帽子可以抵挡日照和雨淋，但任何强于日晒雨淋的东西都会使它的功效大大减弱。
A hat keeps off the sun and rain, but gives little protection against anything more forceful.
一种可以抵挡射入的阳光的帽子，但是不能抵挡比阳光强的东西。
Straw hats are mostly worn by peasants as protection against the sun.
稻草帽大多是农民用来防晒的。
A precursor of berets, bonnets and other round hats, popular especially amongst the burgher class.
贝雷帽、软帽、圆边帽的前身，在市民阶层中尤为流行。
An important 15th century fashion item for honourable women, for whom going bare-headed was indecent.
一件15世纪时地位尊贵女性重要的流行物品，因为不戴头巾人会被视为无礼。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Axe<br/><br/>A proper axe for a proper fight! The weight of this axe guarantees that every blow will strike hard and even armoured knights will cower in fear from it; its massive size and metal-plated haft help block a foe's attacks.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 斧子 <br/><br/> 用正经斧头打正经仗!这把斧头的重量使得每次攻击猛烈甚至装甲骑士都畏惧、退缩;其庞大的体积以及金属把手有助于阻挡敌人的攻击

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Mace<br/><br/>A fully metal-plated war hammer that no armour can stop and which, in the hands of a strong warrior, demands respect on the battlefield and in times of peace.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 钉头锤 <br/><br/> 全金属的战锤，无甲可挡，只有强壮的战士才能佩带，不论在战场上或者和平时期都要保持敬畏
Herring can be smoked, roasted, pickled or boiled. It's very tasty, but one of the boniest fish there are.
鲱鱼，能被烟熏、烘烤、腌制、煮熟。非常美味，但是鱼刺非常多。
High boots were worn primarily by the wealthier classes, since they served as riding boots for those who could afford horses. They are therefore usually fashioned from good quality material.
高筒靴主要是富裕阶层的选择，因为它们被能买得起马的人作为马靴使用，也因此采用上乘材料手工制造。
Honey in a honeycomb, useful to the apothecary, cook, candlemaker and brown bear.
巢状蜂蜜，对药剂师、厨师、做蜡烛的人和棕熊有用。
The hood is a simple head covering that covers the head and also the shoulders and upper body with a short cape or mantle.
风帽是一种可以盖住头并用短披肩或斗篷遮住肩膀和上半身的简易帽子。
The forged chanfron protects the horse's head. The attached chain-mail or plate criniere protects the neck.
锻制的马盔可以保护马的头部。附带的锁甲或板甲护颈可以保护其颈部。
A forged piece of horse armour that protects its head, nose and eyes effectively from frontal attack.
一块煅制的，用来防护马的脑袋、鼻子以及眼睛的马铠。面对从前方袭来的攻击防护效果显著。
A leather facemask reinforced with steel that provides the horse's head with basic protection without unduly limiting movement or vision.
一块由钢片支撑的皮质面具，在有基本的头部防御之上，还能减少对马匹视野的遮挡。
A simple wrought steel plate that can be fixed to the horse's face to provide basic protection against frontal attack.
一个可以贴合马脸的简易制造的钢板，可以对前方袭来的进攻进行比较基础的防御。
Horseshoes made for farm horses. Apart from protecting the hooves, they do nothing else.
一种专门为农场马制作的蹄铁，除了保护马蹄以外，它们再无用处。
Horseshoes suited to long journeys as well as quick flights from ambushes in the woods.
马蹄铁适用于长途旅行以及从有埋伏的森林里中迅速撤退。
A noble's time is precious, which is why these shoes are designed to accelerate the horse's trot and canter.
贵族的时间是宝贵的,这就是为什么这些鞋的设计都是为了加速马的小跑和慢跑。
Solidly forged horseshoes for warhorses of warriors in full armour, which make their mounts capable of the fastest gallop.
为全副武装战士的战马锻造的坚固的马蹄铁，能使他们的坐骑快速奔驰。
Horseradish so spicy it could cut your tongue off.
辣根会把你舌头都辣断！
Raw radish is sharp enough to burn your tongue, but cooking takes the edge off it.
生萝卜能辣得烧掉你的舌头，但煮熟后就不那么辣了。
Give Robin Hood his cap back!
把侠盗罗宾汉的帽子还给他！

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Polearm<br/><br/>A hunting weapon that helps keep at a distance, especially suited for hunting wild boar. The reasonable weight of the hunting spear and its stabbing attacks are its best features.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长杆兵器 <br/><br/> 一种用于狩猎的武器，可以使你与猎物保持一定的距离，尤其适用于追捕野猪。狩猎长矛最大的两个优点就是它重量合理且易于进行穿刺攻击

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Hunting sword<br/><br/>Originally a hunter's weapon, which served to finish off prey and butcher the carcass. Due to its similarity to the short sword, it began to be carried by burghers, whose social status warranted carrying an ornate weapon. Contrary to the short sword, however, it has only one sharpened edge and is unsuited to stabbing. Many of them lack crossguards, making it worse for blocking.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 猎剑 <br/><br/> 最初是猎人的武器，用来杀死猎物并屠宰尸体。由于和短剑相似，它开始被市民所佩带——携带华丽的武器以保证其社会地位。但与短剑相反，它只有一面开锋并且不适合刺。很多都没的这种剑有剑格，不利于格挡
A glass goblet, not for every Tom, Dick and Harry. Glass is a rare material and this piece is a work of art.
玻璃酒杯，不是随随便便给什么无名小辈用的，玻璃本身就是一种稀罕物，这玩意简直是件艺术品。
The chaperon is type of decorative hood or hat, with a long liripipe or tail. It has no special protective properties, but it makes you look very respectable indeed.
这种带有长尾帽子是一种用于装饰的风帽或者礼帽，没有专有保护特性，但确实能使你看起来体面
Pavel's fine chaperon, probably made by himself.
帕瓦尔的头巾，八成是他自己做的。
Powder from the little finger bone of St. Thomas! Protects against distracted thoughts and clouded sight.
粉小指骨的圣托马斯!防止分心思想和笼罩。
Rare crystal from beneath Mount Kyffhauser in Germany. Protects against evil forces and spells, disperses nightmares!
德国基弗霍伊泽山脉下的稀有水晶。防御邪恶的力量和咒语，驱散噩梦！
An altar candle from France, permeated with divine benevolence.
一支来自法国的祭坛蜡烛，洋溢着神圣的仁慈。
Powdered unicorn horn cures impaired manliness.
独角兽的角粉能治疗受损的男子气概。
Mandrake root plucked beneath the scaffold. Carried on the bosom for two months, it will cure infertility.
在绞刑架下拔的曼德拉草根。放在胸前两个月能治不孕不育。
Salt scraped from the bloody tears of St. James' Madonna! Purges the air of all ailments and disease.
从圣詹姆斯的马多娜的血泪提取的盐！能让所有的疾病与不适消失得无隐无踪。
The powerful stones Urim and Thummin, which the ancient Jewish fathers used to foresee things yet to come.
古代犹太教大祭司用作占卜的石头
Grapes grown on a rose bush! A miraculous taste and healing powers!
长在玫瑰从上的葡萄！口味奇异且有治愈能力！
A quarter of cheese. Properly stored, it will keep well and is filling.
四分之一的奶酪，保存恰当的话，它能保持完好的形状且能给人饱腹感。
Gives the cheese a more mature flavour. Excellent with an equally dry wine.
使得奶酪的味道更加纯熟。和干红酒搭配是天作之合。
Whether from cow or sheep cheese, always good.
不管是牛奶奶酪还是羊奶奶酪都很香。
Wonder what it contains? It's locked, unfortunately.
想知道里头有什么？可惜它上锁了。
A bag of grain that will put a smile on any beak.
一袋谷物，能让鸡喙笑起来
Who could refuse a nice, juicy chicken leg with crispy golden skin?
谁能拒绝一个美味多汁的黄金脆皮烤鸡腿呢？
There's not a lot of eating in a chicken heart, but it'll keep you chewing for a while.
虽然鸡心肉很少，但是很有嚼头。
A valued village delicacy. There's not much eating in it, though. Better for adding to soup.
一种珍贵的乡村美味，虽然它也没什么可吃的，但加在汤里会更好。
The humerus is the long bone of the upper arm. Quite heavy, but now probably too brittle to use as a bludgeon.
肱骨是上臂的一根长骨头。挺重的，但是作为武器实在是太脆了……
The cranium or skull. Alas, poor Lev...
颅骨，也称头骨。唉，可怜的列夫……
The thorax or rib cage, consisting of the sternum, or breastplate, the ribs and vertebral column. Maybe could be used as a basket for carrying the other bones?
胸膛，也就是胸腔，由胸骨，亦称胸板，及肋骨和脊柱组成。也许可以当作装其他骨头的篮子？
The femur or thigh bone. The longest bone in the human body.
股骨，又名大腿骨。是人体中最长的骨头。
The manus or hand, composed of phalanges or finger bones, carpal and metacarpal bones.
前肢，也就是手，由指骨，也就是手指，腕骨和掌骨组成。
Papers identifying the bearer as a member of the Papal Inquisitor Bishop Jaroslav of Beneshov's retinue.
证明文件的携带者是教皇钦点主教审判官雅洛斯拉夫的随从
A simple type of helmet in widespread use.
帽盔，样式简单且用途很广
The quilted coat makes a nice outer garment for city folk. Equipped with fancy buttons!
絮棉的夹克是城里人眼中的精美外衣，配有极好看的纽扣。
Originally a nice scarf that Thomas from Ledetchko mill had in his pocket, apparently for quite some time.
起初是一条漂亮的围巾,显然，拉迪亚茨克磨坊的托马斯已经在他的口袋里放了很长一段时间了
Lightly salted, dried meat is durable and nutritious - the best thing to take on long marches.
淡盐肉干能长期保存且营养丰富——长途行军佳选
A strong spirit that will burn away all physical and spiritual woes.
烈酒能灼走所有生理或灵魂上的伤痛。
Woodcutter Julian's beloved axe. Sometimes he even sleeps with it under his pillow.
伐木工朱利安最爱的斧子，有时候他甚至会把它放在枕头下睡觉
A quilted coat makes a nice outer garment for city folk.
棉袄是城里人出门的首选衣物
The quilted coat makes a nice outer garment for city folk. Equipped with fancy buttons!
絮棉的外套让城里人看着帅气。配有极好看的扣子！
A heavier woollen outer coat lined with linen, suitable for inclement weather and for travelling.
一种用亚麻布做内衬的有分量的外套，适合天气严寒或在外游历时穿
On the greatest ruler of the Kingdom of Bohemia, Charles IV, who raised his kingdom from ashes.
波西米亚最伟大的统治者，查尔斯四世，此人从一片荒芜中建立了王国。
来自一个强盗箱子里的钥匙
Keys to all the doors in the building.
能打开这栋楼里所有门的钥匙。
来自厄里克的箱子的钥匙。
The key to the door of the potter's house.
打开波特家家门的钥匙。
Keys to all trunks in the building.
能打开这栋楼里所有箱子的钥匙。
Keys from all the Inquisitor's trunks.
The key to Sir Erhart's chest, wherein may be concealed who knows what.
能够打开厄哈特大人的箱子的钥匙，谁知套它被藏在了那里。
打开马蒂亚斯的储物箱的钥匙
The key to a trunk belonging to one bandit.
一个曾属于强盗的箱子钥匙
All your keys on a ring.
你所有的钥匙都在钥匙环上
A keyring with all the door keys I've got.
我得到的钥匙串里有能打开所有门的钥匙。
A keyring with all the trunk keys I've got.
一个挂有我所有箱子钥匙的钥匙圈。
Deer kidneys, a delicacy of hunters and nobility.
鹿肾，猎人和贵族的一道佳肴。
Deer kidneys are a delicacy favoured by the nobility. You'll love them too.
鹿肾是一种贵族喜爱的佳肴，你也会爱上它的！
Sausage smoked slowly in beechwood smoke.
烧山毛榉材慢慢熏制的香肠。
Containing two age-old prayers: Lord Have Mercy and Prayer to St. Wenceslas.
包含两段古老的祷文：《求主怜悯》和《向圣瓦茨拉夫祈祷》
A brief history of the Kingdom of Bohemia.
一本简短的介绍波西米亚历史的书。
An ancient symbol of birth and life. Hard-boiled.
一个关于出生与生命的古老的象征，煮的挺老的。
How to brew exquisite mead in the home from readily available ingredients.
如何用家常的原料做出上好的蜂蜜酒。
一本叫我们警惕库曼人的书。
The axe that Kunesh got from my father on credit and never paid for.
斧头是库尼什向我父亲赊账得来的，一直没还。
The hammer Kunesh got on credit from my father and never paid for.
库尼什从我父亲那赊购的，然后再也没有付过钱。
The nails Father wants Kunesh to pay for.
父亲想要库尼什付的钱
Bunch of keys with the key from Kunesh's chest
与从库尼什的箱子里拿出来的钥匙
On the election of the Holy Roman Emperor.
选举神圣罗马帝国的皇帝。
A forged leave of absence for Konrad Kyeser.
康拉德·吉赛尔的伪造的缺任许可书
Document from Karel's trunk regarding construction in Sasau Monastery.
卡雷尔箱内关于莎邵修道院建筑物的文件
The tunic is a favourite outer garment of poorer folk.
丘尼卡是一款受穷人喜爱的外罩。
Fine quality mutton from Bohemian curly-haired sheep, raised in open pens and guarded by a ginger-haired lad with a whistle.
品质上乘的羔羊肉，产自放养的且由戴口哨的黄头发小伙看顾的波西米亚卷毛羊，
This cooked mutton will melt in your mouth.
It's a shame to dry such tender, juicy meat, but if you've got more than you know what to do with...
如此柔软多汁的肉拿来风干真是暴殄天物，但如果你的肉太多了不知道该怎么办才好……
Prime meat from Bohemian curly-wool sheep kept in open fields, smoked to keep for leaner times.
散养的上等波希米亚卷毛羊肉。烟熏过后可以保存更长时间。

Lamellar armour is composed of small rectangular plates of hard leather laced together in rows with wire. This was an early form of armour that remained in use in the Orient. It is light and suitable for mounted fighters; it protects against arrows and slashing swords.
鳞甲是由硬皮的小矩形板和金属丝交织在一起的。这是盔甲最开始的形式，至今仍在东方使用。其轻便性易于装备骑兵防御弓箭和挥砍类的剑。
Lamellar pauldrons protect the combatant's shoulders.
鳞甲护肩能保护战士的肩部。
Lard is animal fat, very useful for frying and basting roasts. You shouldn't eat the whole jar on its own - it'll stuff you and lubricate your innards.
猪油是动物脂肪,用于油炸和烤肉都非常好，你不会想独自吃掉整罐——那会让你有腹胀和油糊住内脏的感觉。
The Last Will and Testament of Vincent in Merhojed, which I have to bring to Father Fabian in Sasau.
莫霍杰德的文森特的遗嘱，我得带给他在莎邵的父亲费边。
About a Farmer and a Goose.
一个农夫和一只鹅的故事
Nearly knee-high leather boots that keep at bay dirt, water and cold.
近膝长的皮靴能防海湾泥土，防水和抵御寒冷
Worn by many brigands and footpads, yet this jerkin outlived each and every one of them, as it doesn't offer much protection.
经常是强盗和拦路贼的穿着，然而这些坎肩比这些人都要长寿，因为它没什么防护作用。
Lentils are readily available legumes that make a good base for soup.
兵豆作为现成的豆类能做成很不错的汤底。
You can easily recognise the lepiota even at a distance. It's tall and has a wide cap.
即使在远处，你也能很容易的识别出环柄菇，它又高又有宽帽。
Cooked lepiota has a mild taste. It serves the poor as a substitute for meat.
熟环柄菇味道比较温和。被穷人当做肉类的替代品。
So much better fresh, sliced and fried in pork lard. But it doesn't keep well.
如果是新鲜的切好，并在猪大油里煎一下就好多了。但这样的话就放不久了……
Key to the bookcase with forbidden books.
打开放着禁书的书柜的钥匙。
How the fox found a pitcher and how her pride and anger let her to her death.
讲一个找到了水罐的狐狸，因为自己的自大与急躁害死了自己。
Document for the Royal Bailiff in Kuttenberg.
寄给库腾堡的钦差大臣的文件
Deer liver, as pure as the Bohemian forests. Well-prized and tasty.
鹿肝，跟波西米亚森林一样纯净。很名贵，而且很美味。
Deer liver on its own is excellent, but just add lard, a little spring onion and bacon and roast it lightly - divine!
羊肝本身就是极好的食物了，要是再加上猪油，一些大葱和培根，再烘烤一小会——简直太妙了！
A tool to pick locks. Just use it carefully!
一种开锁的工具。谨慎使用！
A completely average longsword with average properties and very low requirements for wielding it. Suitable for practice.
非常普通的长剑，性能一般，使用门槛低。适合用来练习。

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>The longsword of St. Michael, patron of soldiers and sentries, guardians of law and order and defenders. The masterfully-forged blade of steel that would do even the Archangel proud is made of the best material and its rich ornament makes it a fine piece.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 圣迈克尔长剑，是士兵、哨兵、法律与秩序的守护者以及境外守护者的卫士，这把精锻的钢制剑用材上乘且装饰丰富多彩，甚至能让大天使畏惧，是一件精品！

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>An exclusive piece - a longsword with such a high-quality blade that it was named after the Biblical King Herod, who won infamy by beheading John the Baptist.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 一把独一无二的剑，剑身质量上乘，以圣经中因斩首施洗者约翰而声名狼藉的希律王命名

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>A longsword named after Longinus, the Roman centurion who pierced Christ's side on the cross. It has a very sharp tip that can deal with any armour as easily as with the Son of God.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 以朗基努斯的名字命名的长剑，此人是刺伤了钉在十字架上的基督侧腹的罗马百夫长。十分锋利的剑端，使它能像对付耶稣基督那样容易地穿刺其他任何盔甲

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>A longsword forged with famed German precision, which stays sharp even after rough treatment. It is a weapon that earns the respect of soldiers and nobles and assures every swordsman that it will endure to the end of the combat.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 一把由的有名的德国精密技术锻造的长剑，即使粗暴对待，也仍旧锋利。它赢得了战士与贵族的尊敬，它的品质也让每一个剑客相信它会坚持到战斗的最后一刻

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>The longsword of St. George is the best the 15th century blacksmith's art can produce. A beautifully balanced sword, it's ornamented sharp blade and piercing point can deal with any plate armour. The blade is fragile though, and must be kept maintained. Apart from its combat qualities, the sword is a status symbol for the upper classes.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 圣乔治的长剑是凭十五世纪的铁匠技艺所能出产的最终之最，这把剑平衡性能完美，它带有的锐利的剑刃以及刺穿尖头，让它能击破任何板甲，但剑刃较脆弱且必须持续保养。除了它的战斗素质以外，这把剑还是上层社会的地位象征

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>A rusty longsword someone's granddad once brought back from his world roaming. There's nothing exceptional about it except its age and universal use. Plus the fact that it's quite likely to fall to pieces in your hand.
<font color='#512D00'> 武器种类： </font> 长剑 <br/><br/> 某人的爷爷在漫游世界时带回来的一把锈迹斑斑的短剑。这把剑很老旧，可随意使用，除此之外没有什么特别的。顺便说一句，它很有可能在你手上碎成渣

<font color='#512D00'>Weapon type: </font>Longsword<br/><br/>A long sword with a blade forged and honed for slashing blows. The increased weight of the long sword ensures a clean cut, even through armour, although blocking enemies' blows will dull the blade, so attack is the best form of defence!
